00048 /*****************************************************************************\
00049  *      File:   md_preprocessor.c
00050  * 
00051  *      Description: The preprocessor for the IMPACT Meta-Description Language
00052  * 
00053  *      Creation Date:  October 1994
00054  * 
00055  *      Authors: John C. Gyllenhaal and Wen-mei Hwu
00056  *
00057  *      Revisions:
00058  *          John C. Gyllenhaal August 1995
00059  *          Enhanced expression evaluation routines
00060  *  
00061  *          John C. Gyllenhaal November 1996
00062  *          Modified $def semantics so that braces are not allowed in
00063  *          the '$def def_name def_value' form.  This allows a more helpful
00064  *          error message to be given for the subtly buggy text below:
00065  *             $if (1 == 1) {$def foo 1}
00066  *             $else {$def foo 2}
00067  *          The problem with this code is that foo is defined to '1}', so
00068  *          the $else inadvertently appears in the body of the $if.
00069  *
00070  *          John C. Gyllenhaal January 1997
00071  *          1) Added support to allow recursive text replacement.  
00072  *             For example, ${array_${index}} is now supported.
00073  * 
00074  *          2) Added new $for form which allows multiple value lists to be
00075  *             be specified.  The lists must be the same length and they
00076  *             are stepped through in parallel.
00077  *             For example: "$for ((I in 1 2)(J in 3 4)) {${I} ${J} }"
00078  *             Yields: "1 3 2 4 "
00079  *                          
00080  *          3) Added support for floating-point expression evaluation.
00081  *             Form: $.={floating-point expression}
00082  * 
00083  *          4) Now, by default, implicit text replacement does not occur.
00084  *             For example: "$def I {10}  I = ${I}"
00085  *             Now yields: "  I = 10" instead of "  10 = 10"
00086  * 
00087  *          5) Enhanced $def and $for to allow user to enable implicit text
00088  *             replacement by placing a '!' in front of the def_name(s).
00089  *             For example: "$def !I {10}  I = ${I}"
00090  *             Now yields: "  10 = 10"
00091  *      
00092  *          Many thanks to Shail Aditya and Bruce Childers for their 
00093  *          suggestions which led to the above enhancements!
00094  *  
00095  *  
00096 \*****************************************************************************/
00097

00109 /* Symbol tables */
00110 Psymbol_Table *Pdef_table = NULL;
00111 Psymbol_Table *Mfile_table = NULL;
00112 
00113 /* Allow disabling of text replacement during processing of text replacement
00114  * directives.  
00115  */
00116 int allow_text_replacement = 1;
00117 
00118 /* Setting to a non-zero value disables implicit text replacement.
00119  * This may be done during the processing of a text replacement directive
00120  * or by a user directive (soon to be implemented).
00121  *
00122  * This variable will be incremented to disable implict text replacement
00123  * and decremented to possibly turn it back on (allows multiple nested
00124  * sets and resets (only the last one should really take effect)
00125  * to be properly modeled).
00126  */
00127 int disable_implicit_text_replacement = 0;

00153 void
00154 print_usage (char *fmt, ...)
00155 {
00156   va_list args;
00157 
00158   /* Print out error message if fmt is not NULL */
00159   if (fmt != NULL)
00160     {
00161       fprintf (stderr, "\nError: ");
00162       va_start (args, fmt);
00163       vfprintf (stderr, fmt, args);
00164       va_end (args);
00165       fprintf (stderr, "\n");
00166     }
00167 
00168   fprintf (stderr, "\n");
00169   fprintf (stderr, "usage: %s [options] [input_file]\n\n", program_name);
00170   fprintf (stderr, "options:\n");
00171   fprintf (stderr,
00172            "  -o output_file    outputs to output_file instead of to standard "
00173            "output.\n");
00174   fprintf (stderr,
00175            "  -stdin            reads input from standard input instead of "
00176            "input_file.\n");
00177   fprintf (stderr,
00178            "  -no_directives    suppresses output of line directives.\n");
00179   fprintf (stderr, "\n");
00180   fprintf (stderr,
00181            "  -Ddef_name=value  overrides $def directives in input "
00182            "(until hit $undef.).\n");
00183   fprintf (stderr, "\n");
00184   fprintf (stderr, "debug options:\n");
00185   fprintf (stderr,
00186            "  -bypass_alloc     use malloc instead of alloc routines.\n");
00187   fprintf (stderr, "  -print_usage      prints alloc routine stats.\n");
00188   fprintf (stderr, "\n");
00189   exit (1);
00190 }
00191 
00192 void
00193 read_command_line_parameters (int argc, char **arg_ptr)
00194 {
00195   char *name, *value;
00196 
00197   /* Get program name for error messages */
00198   program_name = strdup (*arg_ptr);
00199 
00200   /* Start parsing arguments at first argument */
00201   arg_ptr++;
00202   for (; *arg_ptr != NULL; arg_ptr++)
00203     {
00204       /* If first character is a '-', must be an option */
00205       if ((*arg_ptr)[0] == '-')
00206         {
00207           /* Get output file */
00208           if (strcmp (*arg_ptr, "-o") == 0)
00209             {
00210               /* Make sure -o not specified twice */
00211               if (output_file_name != NULL)
00212                 {
00213                   print_usage ("-o option specified twice.");
00214                 }
00215 
00216               /* Get output file name, expect it to be non-NULL */
00217               arg_ptr++;
00218               if (*arg_ptr == NULL)
00219                 {
00220                   print_usage ("expected '-o output_file'.\n");
00221                 }
00222               output_file_name = strdup (*arg_ptr);
00223             }
00224           /* Get -Ddef_name=value directives */
00225           else if ((*arg_ptr)[1] == 'D')
00226             {
00227               /* Malloc copy and parse into name and value */
00228               name = strdup (&(*arg_ptr)[2]);
00229 
00230               /* Make sure first character is a valid */
00231               if ((name[0] != '_') && !isalpha (name[0]))
00232                 {
00233                   print_usage ("invalid def_name in '%s'.\n", *arg_ptr);
00234                 }
00235 
00236               /* Find equals */
00237               for (value = name; *value != 0; value++)
00238                 {
00239                   /* Stop when hit equals */
00240                   if (*value == '=')
00241                     {
00242                       break;
00243                     }
00244 
00245                   /* Make sure name before it is a valid identifier */
00246                   if ((*value != '_') && !isalnum (*value))
00247                     {
00248                       print_usage ("invalid def_name in '%s'.\n", *arg_ptr);
00249                     }
00250                 }
00251               /* If equals doesn't exist, set value to "" */
00252               if (*value == 0)
00253                 {
00254                   value = "";
00255                 }
00256               else
00257                 {
00258                   /* Terminate name at equals */
00259                   *value = 0;
00260 
00261                   /* Set value string to rest of argument */
00262                   value++;
00263                 }
00264 
00265               /* Command line definitions are at level 2 and 
00266                * do not allow implicit text replacement.
00267                */
00268               add_Pdef (name, value, 0, 2);
00269 
00270               /* Free malloced string */
00271               free (name);
00272             }
00273 
00274           /* Get -stdin flag */
00275           else if (strcmp (*arg_ptr, "-stdin") == 0)
00276             {
00277               using_stdin = 1;
00278             }
00279 
00280           /* Get -no_directives flag */
00281           else if (strcmp (*arg_ptr, "-no_directives") == 0)
00282             {
00283               print_line_directives = 0;
00284             }
00285 
00286           /* Get -bypass_alloc flag */
00287           else if (strcmp (*arg_ptr, "-bypass_alloc") == 0)
00288             {
00289               bypass_alloc_routines = 1;
00290             }
00291 
00292           /* Get -print_usage flag */
00293           else if (strcmp (*arg_ptr, "-print_usage") == 0)
00294             {
00295               print_alloc_usage = 1;
00296             }
00297           else
00298             {
00299               print_usage ("unknown command line option '%s'.\n", *arg_ptr);
00300             }
00301         }
00302 
00303       /* Otherwise, must be file name (can only be one of command line) */
00304       else
00305         {
00306           if (input_file_name != NULL)
00307             {
00308               print_usage ("only one input file may be specified.\n");
00309 
00310             }
00311 
00312           /* Get input file name */
00313           input_file_name = strdup (*arg_ptr);
00314         }
00315     }
00316 
00317   /* Make sure input file has been specified */
00318   if ((input_file_name == NULL) && !using_stdin)
00319     {
00320       /* Print error only if they specified something */
00321       if (argc > 1)
00322         {
00323           print_usage ("input_file or -stdin must be specified.\n");
00324         }
00325       else
00326         {
00327           print_usage (NULL);
00328         }
00329     }
00330 
00331   /* Make sure input_file and -stdin have not both been specified */
00332   if ((input_file_name != NULL) && using_stdin)
00333     {
00334       print_usage ("may not specify both input_file and -stdin.\n");
00335     }
00336 
00337   /* Make sure input and output file are not the same */
00338   if ((input_file_name != NULL) && (output_file_name != NULL) &&
00339       (strcmp (input_file_name, output_file_name) == 0))
00340     {
00341       print_usage
00342         ("may not specify input file (%s) that is the same as output file.",
00343          input_file_name);
00344     }
00345 
00346 }

00349 /*
00350  * Overrides lcode library's version.
00351  */
00352 void
00353 L_punt (char *fmt, ...)
00354 {
00355   va_list args;
00356 
00357   va_start (args, fmt);
00358   vfprintf (stderr, fmt, args);
00359   va_end (args);
00360   fprintf (stderr, "\n");
00361 
00362   exit (-1);
00363 }

00365 
00366 /*
00367  * Parse error handler.
00368  * First argument is a pptr that points to where the error occured.
00369  * The second argument is a printf format string, and the rest
00370  * are the arguments for the format string.
00371  */
00372 void
00373 Perror (Pptr * pptr, char *fmt, ...)
00374 {
00375   va_list args;
00376   Mptr *mptr;
00377   int i;
00378   int text_replaced;
00379   int error_pos;
00380 
00381 
00382   /* Get mptr for ease of use */
00383   mptr = pptr->mptr;
00384 
00385   /* Backup one character if file (if possible) to point at
00386    * character or identifier just preprocessed.  This is vital
00387    * for errors that occur at end of a line, since mptr and
00388    * pptr point to different lines.
00389    *
00390    * Test to make sure have a least one character in file (Mbackupc will
00391    * punt if this is not the case).  (Do Mbackupc if at EOF or not
00392    * at the first character in the file.)
00393    */
00394   if ((mptr->mline == NULL) || (mptr->pos != 0) ||
00395       (mptr->mline->line_no != 0))
00396     Mbackupc (mptr);
00397 
00398   /* 
00399    * Print out text line of text where error occured and put arrow to
00400    * location.  (pos starts at 0, so add 1 to get to column, but
00401    * subtract one since Pgetc reads one or more characters ahead)
00402    */
00403   fprintf (stderr, "\n");
00404   /* If not at EOF */
00405   if (mptr->mline != NULL)
00406     {
00407       fprintf (stderr,
00408                "Error during preprocessing (line %i char %i of %s):\n",
00409                mptr->mline->line_no, mptr->pos + 1, mptr->mfile->name);
00410     }
00411 
00412   /* otherwise, at EOF */
00413   else
00414     {
00415       fprintf (stderr,
00416                "Error during preprocessing (%s at EOF):\n",
00417                mptr->mfile->name);
00418 
00419     }
00420 
00421   /*Print error message */
00422   va_start (args, fmt);
00423   vfprintf (stderr, fmt, args);
00424   va_end (args);
00425   fprintf (stderr, "\n");
00426   fprintf (stderr, "\n");
00427 
00428 
00429   /* If at EOF, do not print out file text */
00430   if (mptr->mline != NULL)
00431     {
00432       /* Detect text replacement, assume none */
00433       text_replaced = 0;
00434       for (i = 0; i < pptr->expanded->cur_len; i++)
00435         {
00436           if (mptr->mline->buf[i] != pptr->expanded->buf[i])
00437             {
00438               text_replaced = 1;
00439               break;
00440             }
00441         }
00442 
00443     }
00444 
00445   /* If at EOF, print out replacement text if exists */
00446   else
00447     {
00448       if (pptr->expanded_pos > 0)
00449         text_replaced = 1;
00450       else
00451         text_replaced = 0;
00452     }
00453 
00454   /* If text has been replaced, show point (after scanning for text
00455    * replacement and show line after text replacement 
00456    */
00457   if (text_replaced)
00458     {
00459       /* Print out file text where error occurred, if not at EOF */
00460       fprintf (stderr, "File text where error occurred:\n");
00461       if (mptr->mline != NULL)
00462         {
00463           print_buf_with_arrow (stderr, mptr->mline->buf, mptr->pos);
00464         }
00465       else
00466         {
00467           fprintf (stderr, "At EOF.\n\n");
00468         }
00469 
00470 
00471       fprintf (stderr, "After incremental text replacement:\n");
00472       print_buf_with_arrow (stderr, pptr->expanded->buf, pptr->expanded_pos);
00473     }
00474 
00475   /* 
00476    * Otherwise, use expanded_pos instead of mptr->mos to give true
00477    * location of error (instead of where we scanned for text replacement).
00478    * Should have expanded_pos = (mptr->pos -1);
00479    */
00480   else
00481     {
00482       /* Print out file text where error occurred */
00483       fprintf (stderr, "File text where error occurred:\n");
00484 
00485       /* Just to be safe, only use pptr->expanded_pos if it is where
00486        * we think it should be.
00487        */
00488       if (pptr->expanded_pos == (mptr->pos - 1))
00489         error_pos = pptr->expanded_pos;
00490       else
00491         error_pos = mptr->pos;
00492       print_buf_with_arrow (stderr, mptr->mline->buf, error_pos);
00493     }
00494 
00495   fprintf (stderr, "Fatal error, cannot continue.\n");
00496   fprintf (stderr, "\n");
00497 
00498   exit (-1);
00499 }
00500 
00501 
00502 void
00503 Pputc (Pptr * pptr, int ch)
00504 {
00505   static char *file_name = NULL;
00506   static int file_line = -1, file_pos = 0;
00507   char *input_name;
00508   int input_line;
00509   int name_changed, line_changed;
00510 
00511 
00512   /* Update line no, file if necessary at beginning of every line */
00513   if (file_pos == 0)
00514     {
00515       /* Assume nothing changed */
00516       line_changed = 0;
00517       name_changed = 0;
00518 
00519       /* Get pointer to input file name */
00520       input_name = pptr->mptr->mfile->name;
00521 
00522       /* Get input line number.
00523        * If at EOF, just assume on predicted line.
00524        * If ch is a newline, then mptr is pointing to the next
00525        * line, so adjust input line number back by 1.
00526        */
00527       if (pptr->mptr->mline == NULL)
00528         {
00529           input_line = file_line;
00530         }
00531       else
00532         {
00533           input_line = pptr->mptr->mline->line_no;
00534           if (ch == '\n')
00535             input_line--;
00536         }
00537 
00538       if ((file_name == NULL) || (strcmp (file_name, input_name) != 0))
00539         {
00540           if (file_name != NULL)
00541             free (file_name);
00542           file_name = strdup (input_name);
00543 
00544           /* Mark that file name changed */
00545           name_changed = 1;
00546         }
00547 
00548       if ((pptr->mptr->mline != NULL) && (file_line != input_line))
00549         {
00550           file_line = input_line;
00551 
00552           /* Mark that line changed */
00553           line_changed = 1;
00554         }
00555 
00556       /* Print out line control specifiers if desired */
00557       if (print_line_directives)
00558         {
00559           if (name_changed && line_changed)
00560             fprintf (out, "$line %i \"%s\"\n", file_line, file_name);
00561 
00562           else if (name_changed)
00563             fprintf (out, "$line \"%s\"\n", file_name);
00564 
00565           else if (line_changed)
00566             fprintf (out, "$line %i\n", file_line);
00567         }
00568     }
00569 
00570   /* Output the character to the file */
00571   putc (ch, out);
00572 
00573   /* Update line_no and pos */
00574   if (ch == '\n')
00575     {
00576       file_line++;
00577       file_pos = 0;
00578     }
00579   else
00580     {
00581       file_pos++;
00582     }
00583 }
00584 
00585 int
00586 main (int argc, char **argv, char **envp)
00587 {
00588   FILE *in;
00589   Pptr *pptr;
00590   char ch;
00591   int i;
00592   char *name, *value;
00593 
00594   /* Initialize alloc pools */
00595   Pptr_pool = L_create_alloc_pool ("Pptr", sizeof (Pptr), 16);
00596   Pdef_pool = L_create_alloc_pool ("Pdef", sizeof (Pdef), 16);
00597   String_Node_pool = L_create_alloc_pool ("String_Node",
00598                                           sizeof (String_Node), 16);
00599   Value_List_pool = L_create_alloc_pool ("Value_List",
00600                                          sizeof (Value_List), 16);
00601 
00602   /* Create the temporary buffer for the preprocessor's use */
00603   temp_mbuf = create_Mbuf ();
00604   pptr_mbuf = create_Mbuf ();
00605 
00606 
00607   /* Create symbol tables */
00608   Pdef_table = create_Psymbol_Table ("def");
00609   Mfile_table = create_Psymbol_Table ("open file");
00610 
00611 
00612   /* Read command line arguments and input file name */
00613   read_command_line_parameters (argc, argv);
00614 
00615   /* Parse environment variables and place them in the Pdef table */
00616   for (i = 0; envp[i] != NULL; i++)
00617     {
00618       /* Malloc own copy so can mess with contents */
00619       name = strdup (envp[i]);
00620 
00621       /* Find end of name/start of value */
00622       for (value = name; *value != 0; value++)
00623         {
00624           /* If hit equals, terminate name and move value to next
00625            * position.
00626            */
00627           if (*value == '=')
00628             {
00629               /* Terminate name */
00630               *value = 0;
00631 
00632               /* The rest of the string is the value */
00633               value++;
00634               break;
00635             }
00636         }
00637 
00638       /* Define name at value with level 0 and require explicit replacement
00639        * directives in order to use value.
00640        */
00641       add_Pdef (name, value, 0, 0);
00642 
00643       /* Free name (and implicitly value) */
00644       free (name);
00645     }
00646 
00647   /* Open input file */
00648   if (using_stdin)
00649     {
00650       input_file_name = strdup ("(stdin)");
00651       in = stdin;
00652     }
00653   else
00654     {
00655       if ((in = fopen (input_file_name, "r")) == NULL)
00656         L_punt ("Unable to open input file '%s'.", input_file_name);
00657     }
00658 
00659   /* Open output file */
00660   if (output_file_name == NULL)
00661     {
00662       output_file_name = strdup ("(stdout)");
00663       out = stdout;
00664     }
00665   else
00666     {
00667       if ((out = fopen (output_file_name, "w")) == NULL)
00668         L_punt ("Unable to open output file '%s'.", output_file_name);
00669     }
00670 
00671 
00672   /* Load input file into memory, and add file to symbol table */
00673   current_file = create_Mfile (in, input_file_name, "preprocessing");
00674   add_Psymbol (Mfile_table, current_file->name, current_file);
00675 
00676   /* Get pointer to start of file */
00677   pptr = create_Pptr (current_file);
00678 
00679   /* Create placemarks for preprocessor's use */
00680   temp_placemark = create_Pptr (current_file);
00681   expand_placemark = create_Mptr (current_file);
00682 
00683   while ((ch = Ppeekc (pptr)) != EOF)
00684     {
00685       /* Handle unmatched end curly brackets.  Process body ends when
00686        * encounters this to allow loop constructs to use process_body.
00687        */
00688       if (ch == '}')
00689         {
00690           ch = Pgetc (pptr);
00691           Pputc (pptr, ch);
00692         }
00693       else
00694         {
00695           pptr = process_body (pptr);
00696         }
00697     }
00698 
00699   /* Free up placemarks */
00700   free_Pptr (temp_placemark);
00701   free_Mptr (expand_placemark);
00702 
00703   /* Free up Pptr */
00704   free_Pptr (pptr);
00705 
00706   /* Free symbol tables */
00707   free_Psymbol_Table (Pdef_table, free_Pdef);
00708   free_Psymbol_Table (Mfile_table, (void (*)(void *)) free_Mfile);
00709 
00710   /* Free up temp_mbuf */
00711   free_Mbuf (temp_mbuf);
00712   free_Mbuf (pptr_mbuf);
00713 
00714   /* Print  Lalloc usage if flagged on command line */
00715   if (print_alloc_usage)
00716     {
00717       if (Mfile_pool != NULL)
00718         L_print_alloc_info (stdout, Mfile_pool, 1);
00719       if (Mline_pool != NULL)
00720         L_print_alloc_info (stdout, Mline_pool, 1);
00721       if (Mbuf_pool != NULL)
00722         L_print_alloc_info (stdout, Mbuf_pool, 1);
00723       if (Mptr_pool != NULL)
00724         L_print_alloc_info (stdout, Mptr_pool, 1);
00725       if (Psymbol_Table_pool != NULL)
00726         L_print_alloc_info (stdout, Psymbol_Table_pool, 1);
00727       if (Psymbol_pool != NULL)
00728         L_print_alloc_info (stdout, Psymbol_pool, 1);
00729       L_print_alloc_info (stdout, Pptr_pool, 1);
00730       L_print_alloc_info (stdout, Pdef_pool, 1);
00731       L_print_alloc_info (stdout, String_Node_pool, 1);
00732       L_print_alloc_info (stdout, Value_List_pool, 1);
00733     }
00734 
00735   /* Free alloc pool */
00736   if (Mfile_pool != NULL)
00737     L_free_alloc_pool (Mfile_pool);
00738   if (Mline_pool != NULL)
00739     L_free_alloc_pool (Mline_pool);
00740   if (Mbuf_pool != NULL)
00741     L_free_alloc_pool (Mbuf_pool);
00742   if (Mptr_pool != NULL)
00743     L_free_alloc_pool (Mptr_pool);
00744   if (Psymbol_Table_pool != NULL)
00745     L_free_alloc_pool (Psymbol_Table_pool);
00746   if (Psymbol_pool != NULL)
00747     L_free_alloc_pool (Psymbol_pool);
00748   L_free_alloc_pool (Pptr_pool);
00749   L_free_alloc_pool (Pdef_pool);
00750   L_free_alloc_pool (String_Node_pool);
00751   L_free_alloc_pool (Value_List_pool);
00752 
00753   /* close input/output file.  May be stdin/stdout */
00754   fclose (in);
00755   fclose (out);
00756 
00757   return (0);
00758 }
00759 
00760 
00761 /* Process body and put into mbuf */
00762 Pptr *
00763 process_body (Pptr * pptr)
00764 {
00765   int ch;
00766   int depth;
00767 
00768   /* Start at no { depth */
00769   depth = 0;
00770 
00771   /* Process body until hit } that takes depth <= 0 */
00772   while ((ch = Ppeekc (pptr)) != EOF)
00773     {
00774       /* Handle recursively if preprocessor directive */
00775       if (ch == '$')
00776         {
00777           pptr = process_directive (pptr);
00778         }
00779 
00780       else if (ch == '{')
00781         {
00782           /* Get character, put in file, increase depth */
00783           ch = Pgetc (pptr);
00784           Pputc (pptr, ch);
00785 
00786           depth++;
00787 
00788         }
00789 
00790       else if (ch == '}')
00791         {
00792           /* If don't have matching curly bracket, stop before put in
00793            * file.
00794            */
00795           if (depth <= 0)
00796             break;
00797 
00798           /* Get character, put in file, decrease depth */
00799           ch = Pgetc (pptr);
00800           Pputc (pptr, ch);
00801 
00802           depth--;
00803         }
00804 
00805 
00806       /* If not a preprocessing directive */
00807       else
00808         {
00809           /* Get character and put in file */
00810           ch = Pgetc (pptr);
00811           Pputc (pptr, ch);
00812 
00813           /* Handle backslashes, get the next character if there */
00814           if (ch == '\\')
00815             {
00816               if ((ch = Pgetc (pptr)) != EOF)
00817                 Pputc (pptr, ch);
00818             }
00819 
00820           /* Handle signel quoted strings.  Dump string to file
00821            * until end-quote or end of line.
00822            */
00823           else if (ch == '\'')
00824             {
00825               while ((ch = Pgetc (pptr)) != EOF)
00826                 {
00827                   Pputc (pptr, ch);
00828 
00829                   /* Stop at end-quote or newline */
00830                   if ((ch == '\'') || (ch == '\n'))
00831                     break;
00832 
00833                   /* Handle backslashes, get next character if there 
00834                    * unless newline.
00835                    */
00836                   if (ch == '\\')
00837                     {
00838                       if ((ch = Ppeekc (pptr)) != EOF)
00839                         {
00840                           if (ch != '\n')
00841                             {
00842                               ch = Pgetc (pptr);
00843                               Pputc (pptr, ch);
00844                             }
00845 
00846                         }
00847                     }
00848                 }
00849             }
00850         }
00851     }
00852 
00853   return (pptr);
00854 }
00855 
00856 /* Skip the body's contents (don't print out or process any directives, etc) */
00857 Pptr *
00858 skip_body (Pptr * pptr)
00859 {
00860   int ch;
00861   int depth;
00862 
00863   /* Disable all text processing until hit end of body */
00864   allow_text_replacement = 0;
00865 
00866   /* Start at no { depth */
00867   depth = 0;
00868 
00869   /* Skip body until hit } that takes depth <= 0 */
00870   while ((ch = Ppeekc (pptr)) != EOF)
00871     {
00872       /* Handle curley braces */
00873       if (ch == '{')
00874         {
00875           /* Get character, increase depth */
00876           ch = Pgetc (pptr);
00877 
00878           depth++;
00879 
00880         }
00881 
00882       else if (ch == '}')
00883         {
00884           /* If don't have matching curly bracket, stop before getting char.
00885            */
00886           if (depth <= 0)
00887             break;
00888 
00889           /* Get character,  and decrease depth */
00890           ch = Pgetc (pptr);
00891 
00892           depth--;
00893         }
00894 
00895 
00896       /* If not a preprocessing directive */
00897       else
00898         {
00899           /* Get character and throw it away */
00900           ch = Pgetc (pptr);
00901 
00902           /* Handle backslashes, get the next character if there */
00903           if (ch == '\\')
00904             {
00905               ch = Pgetc (pptr);
00906             }
00907 
00908           /* Handle signel quoted strings.  Skip string 
00909            * until end-quote or end of line.
00910            */
00911           else if (ch == '\'')
00912             {
00913               while ((ch = Pgetc (pptr)) != EOF)
00914                 {
00915                   /* Stop at end-quote or newline */
00916                   if ((ch == '\'') || (ch == '\n'))
00917                     break;
00918 
00919                   /* Handle backslashes, get next character if there 
00920                    * unless newline.
00921                    */
00922                   if (ch == '\\')
00923                     {
00924                       if ((ch = Ppeekc (pptr)) != EOF)
00925                         {
00926                           if (ch != '\n')
00927                             {
00928                               ch = Pgetc (pptr);
00929                             }
00930                         }
00931                     }
00932                 }
00933             }
00934         }
00935     }
00936 
00937   /* Turn back on text processing */
00938   allow_text_replacement = 1;
00939 
00940   return (pptr);
00941 }
00942 
00943 Pptr *
00944 process_def_directive (Pptr * pptr)
00945 {
00946   char *name, *val, ch, *ptr;
00947   int allow_implicit_replacement;
00948 
00949 
00950 
00951   /* Get name being defined, disable implicit text replacement so that the
00952    * name being defined will not be replaced by a previous directive 
00953    * unless explicitly told to.
00954    * This allows names to be easily to be redefined (otherwise a
00955    * $\ is needed before the name being defined the second time)
00956    */
00957   disable_implicit_text_replacement++;
00958 
00959   Pskip_whitespace_no_nl (pptr);
00960 
00961   /* Allow implicit replacement if '!' placed before name */
00962   if (Ppeekc (pptr) == '!')
00963     {
00964       /* Get the '!' */
00965       Pgetc (pptr);
00966 
00967       /* Mark as allowing implicit text replacement */
00968       allow_implicit_replacement = 1;
00969     }
00970   /* Otherwise, by default, don't allow implicit text replacement */
00971   else
00972     {
00973       allow_implicit_replacement = 0;
00974     }
00975   name = Pget_identifier (pptr);
00976 
00977   /* Restore original value of disable_implicit_text_replacement */
00978   disable_implicit_text_replacement--;
00979 
00980   Pskip_whitespace_no_nl (pptr);
00981 
00982   ch = Ppeekc (pptr);
00983 
00984   /* If at EOF or newline, assume just defining name, give no value */
00985   if ((ch == EOF) || (ch == '\n'))
00986     {
00987       val = strdup ("");
00988     }
00989 
00990   /* If start with '(', read in bounded string */
00991   else if (ch == '{')
00992     {
00993       val = Pget_bounded_string (pptr);
00994     }
00995 
00996   /* Otherwise, read to end of line and strip off trailing whitespace 
00997    * 11/26/96 No longer allow '{' and '}' symbols in unbounded 
00998    * $def statements.  Their accidential inclusion causes very
00999    * confusing error messages
01000    */
01001   else
01002     {
01003       /* Get placemark of error messages */
01004       move_Pptr (temp_placemark, pptr);
01005       val = Pget_stripped_line (pptr);
01006 
01007       /* Scan string for illegal '{' or '}' characters */
01008       for (ptr = val; *ptr != '\0'; ptr++)
01009         {
01010           /* Handle backslash characters properly */
01011           if (*ptr == '\\')
01012             {
01013               /* Goto next character */
01014               ptr++;
01015 
01016               /* Make sure there is a next character */
01017               if (*ptr == '\0')
01018                 {
01019                   Perror (temp_placemark,
01020                           "Character missing after backslash in "
01021                           "$def of '%s' to '%s'.\n\n", name, val);
01022                 }
01023             }
01024           else if ((*ptr == '{') || (*ptr == '}'))
01025             {
01026               Perror (temp_placemark,
01027                       "Unexpected '%c' in $def of '%s' to '%s'.\n"
01028                       "  Braces are not allowed in this form of $def.\n\n"
01029                       "Possible solutions:\n"
01030                       "  1) Place '%c' on next line to exclude from $def\n"
01031                       "  2) Place a backslash before '%c'\n"
01032                       "  3) Use '$def def_name {bounded_def_value}' form.\n",
01033                       *ptr, name, val, *ptr, *ptr);
01034             }
01035 
01036           /* Error to have '$' without a backslash */
01037           else if (*ptr == '$')
01038             {
01039               Perror (temp_placemark,
01040                       "Expecting a backslash before '$' in "
01041                       "$def of '%s' to '%s'.\n\n"
01042                       "Note: $def, $undef, $for, $if, and $include "
01043                       "directives may not\n"
01044                       "      be embedded in replacement value strings.",
01045                       name, val);
01046             }
01047         }
01048     }
01049 
01050   /* Add definition to symbol table */
01051   add_Pdef (name, val, allow_implicit_replacement, 1);
01052 
01053   /* Free name and value buffers */
01054   free (name);
01055   free (val);
01056 
01057 
01058   return (pptr);
01059 }
01060 
01061 Pptr *
01062 process_undef_directive (Pptr * pptr)
01063 {
01064   char *name;
01065 
01066 
01067   /* Get name being undefined, disable implicit text replacement so that the
01068    * name being undefined will not be text replaced unless explicitly
01069    * told to do so.
01070    * This allows names to be easily to be undefined (otherwise a
01071    * $\ is needed before the name being undefined).
01072    */
01073   disable_implicit_text_replacement++;
01074 
01075   Pskip_whitespace_no_nl (pptr);
01076   name = Pget_identifier (pptr);
01077 
01078   /* Restore original value of disable_implicit_text_replacement */
01079   disable_implicit_text_replacement--;
01080 
01081   /* Remove definition from symbol table */
01082   delete_Pdef (name);
01083 
01084   /* Free name and value buffers */
01085   free (name);
01086 
01087   return (pptr);
01088 }
01089 
01090 Value_List *
01091 get_for_value_list (Pptr * pptr, Pptr * placemark)
01092 {
01093   Value_List *value_list;
01094   String_Node *value_node;
01095   char *val;
01096   int ch;
01097 
01098   /* Allocate value list */
01099   value_list = (Value_List *) L_alloc (Value_List_pool);
01100 
01101   /* Skip any whitespace before opening '(' */
01102   Pskip_whitespace (pptr);
01103 
01104   /* Move placemark to beginning of value list definition */
01105   move_Pptr (placemark, pptr);
01106 
01107   /* Get ( */
01108   if ((ch = Ppeekc (pptr)) != '(')
01109     Perror (pptr, "Error parsing $for directive, '(' expected not '%c'.", ch);
01110   Pgetc (pptr);
01111 
01112   /* Get variable name, disable implicit text replacement so that the
01113    * variable name will not be replaced by a previous directive unless
01114    * explicitly told to do so.
01115    * This allows names to be easily to be redefined (otherwise a
01116    * $\ is needed before the variable name)
01117    */
01118   disable_implicit_text_replacement++;
01119 
01120   Pskip_whitespace (pptr);
01121 
01122   /* If '!' appears before name, allow implicit text replacement of
01123    * this variable.
01124    */
01125   if (Ppeekc (pptr) == '!')
01126     {
01127       /* Get the '!' and mark that this variable allows implicit text
01128        * replacement.
01129        */
01130       Pgetc (pptr);
01131       value_list->allow_implicit_replacement = 1;
01132     }
01133   else
01134     {
01135       /* Otherwise, do not allow implicit text replacement. */
01136       value_list->allow_implicit_replacement = 0;
01137 
01138     }
01139   value_list->name = Pget_identifier (pptr);
01140 
01141   /* Restore original value of disable_implicit_text_replacement */
01142   disable_implicit_text_replacement--;
01143 
01144   Pskip_whitespace (pptr);
01145 
01146   /* Get 'in' followed by whitespace */
01147   if (Ppeekc (pptr) != 'i')
01148     Perror (pptr, "Error parsing $for directive, 'in' expected.");
01149   Pgetc (pptr);
01150   if (Ppeekc (pptr) != 'n')
01151     Perror (pptr, "Error parsing $for directive, 'in' expected.");
01152   Pgetc (pptr);
01153   if (!isspace (Ppeekc (pptr)))
01154     Perror (pptr, "Error parsing $for directive, 'in' expected.");
01155   Pgetc (pptr);
01156   Pskip_whitespace (pptr);
01157 
01158 
01159   /* Build a list of values until ending ')' */
01160   value_list->first_value = NULL;
01161   value_list->last_value = NULL;
01162   value_list->value_count = 0;
01163   while ((ch = Ppeekc (pptr)) != ')')
01164     {
01165       /* Make sure not at EOF */
01166       if (ch == EOF)
01167         {
01168           Perror (placemark,
01169                   "Expect matching ')' to terminate $for directive's value "
01170                   "list.");
01171         }
01172 
01173       /* Get each value in $for */
01174       val = Pget_for_string (pptr);
01175       Pskip_whitespace (pptr);
01176 
01177       /* Add to linked list */
01178       value_node = (String_Node *) L_alloc (String_Node_pool);
01179 
01180       value_node->string = val;
01181       value_node->next = NULL;
01182 
01183       if (value_list->last_value != NULL)
01184         value_list->last_value->next = value_node;
01185       else
01186         value_list->first_value = value_node;
01187       value_list->last_value = value_node;
01188 
01189       /* Update count of values */
01190       value_list->value_count++;
01191     }
01192 
01193   /* Get ending parenthesis */
01194   ch = Pgetc (pptr);
01195 
01196   /* Make sure there are some values defined */
01197   if (value_list->value_count == 0)
01198     Perror (pptr, "Values expected in $for.");
01199 
01200   /* Return newly created value list for $for */
01201   return (value_list);
01202 }
01203 
01204 Pptr *
01205 process_for_directive (Pptr * pptr, Pptr * placemark)
01206 {
01207   Value_List *first_list, *last_list, *list, *next_list;
01208   String_Node *value_node;
01209   Pptr *loop_start;
01210   int ch;
01211 
01212   /* Initialize list pointers */
01213   first_list = NULL;
01214   last_list = NULL;
01215 
01216   Pskip_whitespace (pptr);
01217 
01218   /* Move placemark to beginning of $for value list */
01219   move_Pptr (placemark, pptr);
01220 
01221   /* Get ( */
01222   if ((ch = Ppeekc (pptr)) != '(')
01223     {
01224       Perror (pptr,
01225               "Error parsing $for directive, '(' expected not '%c'.", ch);
01226     }
01227 
01228   /* Determine if multiple value lists are expected */
01229   Pgetc (pptr);
01230   Pskip_whitespace (pptr);
01231 
01232   /* Only multilist of have second '(', i.e., $for ((i in ...)(j in ...)) */
01233   if (Ppeekc (pptr) != '(')
01234     {
01235       /* Single list form, move back to initial state */
01236       move_Pptr (pptr, placemark);
01237 
01238       /* Get the value list for the $for directive */
01239       list = get_for_value_list (pptr, placemark);
01240 
01241       /* This is the only value list */
01242       first_list = list;
01243       last_list = list;
01244       list->next_list = NULL;
01245     }
01246   else
01247     {
01248       /* Multi list form, get value lists until hit ending ')' */
01249       while ((ch = Ppeekc (pptr)) != ')')
01250         {
01251           /* If not ')', it better be '(' */
01252           if (ch != '(')
01253             {
01254               Perror (pptr,
01255                       "Error parsing $for directive of the form:\n"
01256                       "   $for ((name1 in ...) (name2 in ...) ...) {body}\n\n"
01257                       "Expecting '(' or ')', not '%c' at this point.", ch);
01258             }
01259 
01260           /* Get the value list for the $for directive */
01261           list = get_for_value_list (pptr, placemark);
01262 
01263           /* Add this list to the end of the value list list */
01264           if (last_list == NULL)
01265             first_list = list;
01266           else
01267             last_list->next_list = list;
01268           last_list = list;
01269           list->next_list = NULL;
01270 
01271           /* Make sure this list has the same number of items as
01272            * the first list 
01273            */
01274           if (list->value_count != first_list->value_count)
01275             {
01276               Perror (placemark,
01277                       "Value lists must be the same length for $for "
01278                       "directive of this form:\n"
01279                       "   $for ((name1 in ...) (name2 in ...) ...) {body}\n\n"
01280                       "List for '%s' has length %i but list of '%s' has "
01281                       "length %i!",
01282                       first_list->name, first_list->value_count,
01283                       list->name, list->value_count);
01284             }
01285 
01286           /* Make sure the same name is not defined by multiple lists */
01287           for (list = first_list; list != last_list; list = list->next_list)
01288             {
01289               if (strcmp (list->name, last_list->name) == 0)
01290                 {
01291                   Perror (placemark,
01292                           "A list for '%s' has already been defined in $for "
01293                           "directive of form:\n"
01294                           "   $for ((name1 in ...) (name2 in ...) ...) "
01295                           "{body}\n", last_list->name);
01296                 }
01297             }
01298 
01299           /* Skip whitespace until next value list or ending ')' */
01300           Pskip_whitespace (pptr);
01301         }
01302 
01303       /* Get ending ')' */
01304       Pgetc (pptr);
01305 
01306     }
01307 
01308   /* Skip whitespace until start of loop */
01309   Pskip_whitespace (pptr);
01310 
01311   /* Move placemark to beginning of $for body */
01312   move_Pptr (placemark, pptr);
01313 
01314   /* Get starting '{' */
01315   if ((ch = Ppeekc (pptr)) != '{')
01316     Perror (pptr, "Expect '{' before $for's body.");
01317   Pgetc (pptr);
01318 
01319 
01320   /* Get pointer to start of loop */
01321   loop_start = copy_Pptr (pptr);
01322 
01323   /* Loop once for each value in first list 
01324    * (for multiple lists, the values are traversed in parallel)
01325    */
01326   while (first_list->value_count > 0)
01327     {
01328       /* Move pptr to beginning of loop body */
01329       move_Pptr (pptr, loop_start);
01330 
01331       /* For each list, set the variable to the current value */
01332       for (list = first_list; list != NULL; list = list->next_list)
01333         {
01334           /* Give loop variables heighest priority since it doesn't
01335            * make sense to allow the command line to override them.
01336            */
01337           add_Pdef (list->name, list->first_value->string,
01338                     list->allow_implicit_replacement, 3);
01339         }
01340 
01341       /* Process the loop body */
01342       pptr = process_body (pptr);
01343 
01344       /* For each list, undefine variable after processing body */
01345       for (list = first_list; list != NULL; list = list->next_list)
01346         {
01347           delete_Pdef (list->name);
01348         }
01349 
01350       /* Get end '}' */
01351       if ((ch = Pgetc (pptr)) != '}')
01352         {
01353           Perror (placemark,
01354                   "Matching '}' for $for's body expected before EOF.");
01355         }
01356 
01357       /* For each list, delete the first value  */
01358       for (list = first_list; list != NULL; list = list->next_list)
01359         {
01360           /* Get the first value node */
01361           value_node = list->first_value;
01362 
01363           /* Repair the value list and count */
01364           list->first_value = value_node->next;
01365           if (list->first_value == NULL)
01366             list->last_value = NULL;
01367           list->value_count--;
01368 
01369           /* Delete value node */
01370           free (value_node->string);
01371           L_free (String_Node_pool, value_node);
01372         }
01373     }
01374 
01375   /* Free each list */
01376   for (list = first_list; list != NULL; list = next_list)
01377     {
01378       /* Get the next list before deleting this one */
01379       next_list = list->next_list;
01380 
01381       free (list->name);
01382       L_free (Value_List_pool, list);
01383     }
01384 
01385   /* Free copy to loop start */
01386   free_Pptr (loop_start);
01387 
01388 
01389   return (pptr);
01390 }
01391 
01392 Pptr *
01393 process_if_directive (Pptr * pptr, Pptr * placemark)
01394 {
01395   int ch;
01396   int condition, skip_elses;
01397   char *directive_type;
01398 
01399   Pskip_whitespace (pptr);
01400 
01401   /* Get ( */
01402   if ((ch = Ppeekc (pptr)) != '(')
01403     Perror (pptr, "Error parsing $if directive, '(' expected not '%c'.", ch);
01404   Pgetc (pptr);
01405 
01406   /* Get expression's value */
01407   condition = Pcalc_C_int_expr (pptr, 0);
01408 
01409   Pskip_whitespace (pptr);
01410 
01411   /* Get ) */
01412   if ((ch = Ppeekc (pptr)) != ')')
01413     Perror (pptr, "Error parsing $if directive, ')' expected not '%c'.", ch);
01414   Pgetc (pptr);
01415 
01416   /* Skip whitespace until start of body */
01417   Pskip_whitespace (pptr);
01418 
01419   /* Get starting '{' */
01420   if ((ch = Ppeekc (pptr)) != '{')
01421     Perror (pptr, "Expect '{' before $if's body.");
01422   Pgetc (pptr);
01423 
01424   /* If the condition is met, process the if body, otherwise skip it */
01425   if (condition)
01426     {
01427       /* Process the if body */
01428       pptr = process_body (pptr);
01429 
01430       /* Mark the elses should be skipped */
01431       skip_elses = 1;
01432     }
01433   else
01434     {
01435       pptr = skip_body (pptr);
01436 
01437       /* Mark the elses should be not be skipped */
01438       skip_elses = 0;
01439     }
01440 
01441   /* Get end '}' */
01442   if ((ch = Pgetc (pptr)) != '}')
01443     Perror (placemark, "End '}' of $if expected before EOF.");
01444 
01445 
01446   /* Process $elses or $elifs after $if */
01447   while (1)
01448     {
01449       /* Move placemark to end of last if/else/elif processed */
01450       move_Pptr (placemark, pptr);
01451 
01452       /* Stop if next token is not $else or $elif */
01453       Pskip_whitespace (pptr);
01454 
01455       if (Pgetc (pptr) != '$')
01456         break;
01457 
01458       /* Get the directive type */
01459       directive_type = Pget_alnum_string (pptr);
01460 
01461       if (strcmp (directive_type, "else") == 0)
01462         {
01463           /* Stop if next token is not $else or $elif */
01464           Pskip_whitespace (pptr);
01465 
01466           /* Get starting '{' */
01467           if ((ch = Ppeekc (pptr)) != '{')
01468             Perror (pptr, "Expect '{' before $else's body.");
01469           Pgetc (pptr);
01470 
01471           if (!skip_elses)
01472             {
01473               /* Process the else body */
01474               pptr = process_body (pptr);
01475             }
01476           else
01477             {
01478               pptr = skip_body (pptr);
01479             }
01480 
01481           /* Get end '}' */
01482           if ((ch = Pgetc (pptr)) != '}')
01483             Perror (placemark, "End '}' of $else expected before EOF.");
01484 
01485           /* Move placemark to end of else */
01486           move_Pptr (placemark, pptr);
01487 
01488           /* Free directive type before existing */
01489           free (directive_type);
01490           break;
01491         }
01492       else if (strcmp (directive_type, "elif") == 0)
01493         {
01494           Pskip_whitespace (pptr);
01495 
01496           /* Get ( */
01497           if ((ch = Ppeekc (pptr)) != '(')
01498             Perror (pptr,
01499                     "Error parsing $elif directive, '(' expected not '%c'.",
01500                     ch);
01501           Pgetc (pptr);
01502 
01503           /* Get expression's value */
01504           condition = Pcalc_C_int_expr (pptr, 0);
01505 
01506           Pskip_whitespace (pptr);
01507 
01508           /* Get ) */
01509           if ((ch = Ppeekc (pptr)) != ')')
01510             Perror (pptr,
01511                     "Error parsing $elif directive, ')' expected not '%c'.",
01512                     ch);
01513           Pgetc (pptr);
01514 
01515           /* Skip whitespace until start of body */
01516           Pskip_whitespace (pptr);
01517 
01518           /* Get starting '{' */
01519           if ((ch = Ppeekc (pptr)) != '{')
01520             Perror (pptr, "Expect '{' before $elif's body.");
01521           Pgetc (pptr);
01522 
01523           /* If the condition is met (and not skipping elses), 
01524            * process the elif body, otherwise skip it.
01525            */
01526           if (condition && !skip_elses)
01527             {
01528               /* Process the if body */
01529               pptr = process_body (pptr);
01530 
01531               /* Mark the elses should be skipped */
01532               skip_elses = 1;
01533             }
01534           else
01535             {
01536               pptr = skip_body (pptr);
01537             }
01538 
01539           /* Get end '}' */
01540           if ((ch = Pgetc (pptr)) != '}')
01541             Perror (placemark, "End '}' of $elif expected before EOF.");
01542         }
01543       else
01544         {
01545           /* Free directive type before existing */
01546           free (directive_type);
01547           break;
01548         }
01549 
01550       /* Free directive type before going to next directive */
01551       free (directive_type);
01552     }
01553 
01554   /* Move pptr back to end of last if/else/elif processed */
01555   move_Pptr (pptr, placemark);
01556 
01557   return (pptr);
01558 }
01559 Pptr *
01560 process_include_directive (Pptr * pptr, Pptr * placemark)
01561 {
01562   char *file_name;
01563   Psymbol *psymbol;
01564   Mfile *include_file;
01565   Pptr *include_pptr;
01566   int ch;
01567   FILE *in;
01568 
01569   /* Require that $include be the first thing on the line
01570    * and the only thing on the line.
01571    *
01572    * These restrictions are required if the preprocessor
01573    * line directives are going to work properly.
01574    *
01575    * Placemark must be 1 character past $.  If change mptr library,
01576    * this test may not work.
01577    */
01578   if (placemark->mptr->pos != 1)
01579     {
01580       Perror (placemark,
01581               "$include directive must be the first and only thing on "
01582               "the line.");
01583     }
01584 
01585   /* Get quoted string, stripping quotes from string */
01586   file_name = Pget_quoted_string (pptr, 1);
01587 
01588   /* Make sure only other thing on line is a newline */
01589   Pskip_whitespace_no_nl (pptr);
01590   ch = Pgetc (pptr);
01591   if ((ch != '\n') && (ch != EOF))
01592     {
01593       Perror (placemark,
01594               "$include directive must be the first and only thing on "
01595               "the line.");
01596     }
01597 
01598 
01599   /* Search to see if include file already open, if not
01600    * open it and add to open file table.
01601    */
01602   if ((psymbol = find_Psymbol (Mfile_table, file_name)) != NULL)
01603     {
01604       include_file = (Mfile *) psymbol->data;
01605     }
01606   else
01607     {
01608       if ((in = fopen (file_name, "r")) == NULL)
01609         {
01610           Perror (placemark, "Unable to open include file %s.", file_name);
01611         }
01612 
01613       include_file = create_Mfile (in, file_name, "preprocessing");
01614       add_Psymbol (Mfile_table, include_file->name, include_file);
01615     }
01616 
01617   /* Create pointto to start of include file for preprocessing */
01618   include_pptr = create_Pptr (include_file);
01619 
01620   /* Include whole file */
01621   while ((ch = Ppeekc (include_pptr)) != EOF)
01622     {
01623       /* Handle unmatched end curly brackets.  Process body ends when
01624        * encounters this to allow loop constructs to use process_body.
01625        */
01626       if (ch == '}')
01627         {
01628           ch = Pgetc (include_pptr);
01629           Pputc (include_pptr, ch);
01630         }
01631       else
01632         {
01633           include_pptr = process_body (include_pptr);
01634         }
01635     }
01636 
01637   /* Free up include_pptr */
01638   free_Pptr (include_pptr);
01639 
01640   /* Free file_name */
01641   free (file_name);
01642 
01643   return (pptr);
01644 }
01645 
01646 
01647 Pptr *
01648 process_directive (Pptr * pptr)
01649 {
01650   int ch;
01651   char *directive_type;
01652   Pptr *placemark;
01653 
01654   /* Allocate placemark for error messages */
01655   placemark = copy_Pptr (pptr);
01656 
01657   /* Get '$' */
01658   if ((ch = Pgetc (pptr)) != '$')
01659     L_punt ("process_directive: $ expected.");
01660 
01661   /* Get the directive type */
01662   directive_type = Pget_alnum_string (pptr);
01663 
01664   /* Handle whitespace/wierd character after $ */
01665   if (directive_type[0] == 0)
01666     {
01667       Perror (placemark,
01668               "Poorly formed preprocessor directive, expecting either:\n"
01669               " 1) A backslash before the '$' or\n"
01670               " 2) one of the currently supported directives:\n"
01671               "  $include \"name_of_file_to_include\"\n"
01672               "  $def def_name def_value   "
01673               "/* Note: def_value ends at newline */\n"
01674               "  $def def_name {bounded_def_value}\n"
01675               "  ${name}                   /* Forces replacement of name */\n"
01676               "  $\\name                   /* Prevents replacement of name */\n"
01677               "  $?{name}                  /* Replaced with 1 if name defined, "
01678               "0 otherwise */\n"
01679               "  $={integer C expression}\n"
01680               "  $.={floating-point C expression}\n"
01681               "  $if (cond) {body}   $elif (cond) {body}   $else {body}\n"
01682               "  $x..y  or  $(int C expr)..(int C expr)\n"
01683               "  $for (def_name in value1 value2 ... value N) {for_body}\n"
01684               "  $for ((def_name1 in ...)(def_name2 in...)...){for_body}");
01685     }
01686 
01687   /* Handle the different types of directives */
01688   if (strcmp (directive_type, "def") == 0)
01689     {
01690       pptr = process_def_directive (pptr);
01691     }
01692 
01693   else if (strcmp (directive_type, "undef") == 0)
01694     {
01695       pptr = process_undef_directive (pptr);
01696     }
01697 
01698   else if (strcmp (directive_type, "for") == 0)
01699     {
01700       pptr = process_for_directive (pptr, placemark);
01701     }
01702 
01703   else if (strcmp (directive_type, "if") == 0)
01704     {
01705       pptr = process_if_directive (pptr, placemark);
01706     }
01707 
01708   else if (strcmp (directive_type, "else") == 0)
01709     {
01710       Perror (placemark, "$else without associated $if.");
01711     }
01712 
01713   else if (strcmp (directive_type, "elif") == 0)
01714     {
01715       Perror (placemark, "$elif without associated $if.");
01716     }
01717 
01718   else if (strcmp (directive_type, "include") == 0)
01719     {
01720       pptr = process_include_directive (pptr, placemark);
01721     }
01722 
01723 
01724   /* Otherwise, unsupported directive type */
01725   else
01726     {
01727       Perror (placemark,
01728               "Unsupported preprocessing directive '%s'.\n"
01729               "The currently supported directives are:\n"
01730               "  $include \"name_of_file_to_include\"\n"
01731               "  $def def_name def_value   "
01732               "/* Note: def_value ends at newline */\n"
01733               "  $def def_name {bounded_def_value}\n"
01734               "  ${name}                   /* Forces replacement of name */\n"
01735               "  $\\name                   /* Prevents replacement of name */\n"
01736               "  $?{name}                  /* Replaced with 1 if name defined, "
01737               "0 otherwise */\n"
01738               "  $={integer C expression}\n"
01739               "  $.={floating-point C expression}\n"
01740               "  $if (cond) {body}   $elif (cond) {body}   $else {body}\n"
01741               "  $x..y  or  $(int C expr)..(int C expr)\n"
01742               "  $for (def_name in value1 value2 ... value N) {for_body}\n"
01743               "  $for ((def_name1 in ...)(def_name2 in...)...){for_body}",
01744               directive_type);
01745     }
01746 
01747 
01748   /* Free directive type */
01749   free (directive_type);
01750 
01751   /* Free placemark */
01752   free_Pptr (placemark);
01753 
01754   return (pptr);
01755 }
01756 
01757 char *
01758 Pget_alnum_string (Pptr * pptr)
01759 {
01760   int ch;
01761   char *string;
01762 
01763   /* Use temp_mbuf to build string */
01764   clear_Mbuf (temp_mbuf);
01765 
01766   while ((ch = Ppeekc (pptr)) != EOF)
01767     {
01768       if ((ch == '_') || isalnum (ch))
01769         {
01770           ch = Pgetc (pptr);
01771           addc_to_Mbuf (temp_mbuf, ch);
01772         }
01773       else
01774         break;
01775     }
01776 
01777   /* Alloc copy of string in temp_buf */
01778   string = copy_Mbuf_buf (temp_mbuf);
01779 
01780   return (string);
01781 }
01782 
01783 char *
01784 Pget_identifier (Pptr * pptr)
01785 {
01786   int ch;
01787   char *string;
01788 
01789   /* Use temp_mbuf to build string */
01790   clear_Mbuf (temp_mbuf);
01791 
01792   /* Make sure first character is a character or an _ */
01793   ch = Ppeekc (pptr);
01794 
01795   if ((ch != '_') && !isalpha (ch))
01796     Perror (pptr, "Error in identifier at '%c'.", ch);
01797 
01798   while ((ch = Ppeekc (pptr)) != EOF)
01799     {
01800       /* Stop at whitespace only */
01801       if (isspace (ch))
01802         break;
01803 
01804       if ((ch == '_') || isalnum (ch))
01805         {
01806           ch = Pgetc (pptr);
01807           addc_to_Mbuf (temp_mbuf, ch);
01808         }
01809       else
01810         Perror (pptr, "Error in identifier at '%c'.", ch);
01811     }
01812 
01813   /* Alloc copy of string in temp_buf */
01814   string = copy_Mbuf_buf (temp_mbuf);
01815 
01816   return (string);
01817 }
01818 
01819 /* Gets the rest of the line with leading and trailing whitespace stripped */
01820 char *
01821 Pget_stripped_line (Pptr * pptr)
01822 {
01823   int ch;
01824   char *string;
01825 
01826   /* Use temp_mbuf to build string */
01827   clear_Mbuf (temp_mbuf);
01828 
01829   /* Skip leading whitespace */
01830   Pskip_whitespace_no_nl (pptr);
01831 
01832   /* Stop at EOF or newline */
01833   while ((ch = Ppeekc (pptr)) != EOF)
01834     {
01835       if (ch == '\n')
01836         break;
01837 
01838       ch = Pgetc (pptr);
01839       addc_to_Mbuf (temp_mbuf, ch);
01840     }
01841 
01842   /* Strip trailing space */
01843   strip_Mbuf (temp_mbuf);
01844 
01845   /* Alloc copy of string in temp_buf */
01846   string = copy_Mbuf_buf (temp_mbuf);
01847 
01848   return (string);
01849 }
01850 
01851 char *
01852 Pget_quoted_string (Pptr * pptr, int strip_quotes)
01853 {
01854   int ch, quote_ch;
01855   char *string;
01856 
01857   /* Use temp_mbuf to build string */
01858   clear_Mbuf (temp_mbuf);
01859 
01860   /* Skip leading whitespace */
01861   Pskip_whitespace_no_nl (pptr);
01862 
01863   /* Get placemark for error messages */
01864   move_Pptr (temp_placemark, pptr);
01865 
01866   /* Expect opening quote */
01867   ch = Ppeekc (pptr);
01868   if ((ch != '\'') && (ch != '\"'))
01869     {
01870       Perror (pptr, "Open quote (\' or \") expected.");
01871     }
01872   /* Save opening quote to know what to look for in closing quote */
01873   ch = Pgetc (pptr);
01874   quote_ch = ch;
01875 
01876   /* Add quotes to buffer if not stripping quotes from string */
01877   if (!strip_quotes)
01878     addc_to_Mbuf (temp_mbuf, ch);
01879 
01880   while (1)
01881     {
01882       /* Error to have '$' without a backslash */
01883       ch = Ppeekc (pptr);
01884       if (ch == '$')
01885         {
01886           Perror (pptr,
01887                   "Expecting a backslash before '$' in quoted string.\n"
01888                   "Note: $def, $undef, $for, $if, and $include directives "
01889                   "may not\n      be embedded in replacement value strings.");
01890         }
01891 
01892       /* Get next character */
01893       ch = Pgetc (pptr);
01894 
01895       /* Error if hit end of line before endquote */
01896       if ((ch == EOF) || (ch == '\n'))
01897         {
01898           Perror (temp_placemark,
01899                   "Expecting close quote (%c) before end of line.", quote_ch);
01900         }
01901 
01902       /* Detect end quote */
01903       if (ch == quote_ch)
01904         {
01905           /* Add quotes to buffer if not stripping quotes */
01906           if (!strip_quotes)
01907             addc_to_Mbuf (temp_mbuf, ch);
01908           break;
01909         }
01910 
01911       /* Add character to buffer */
01912       addc_to_Mbuf (temp_mbuf, ch);
01913 
01914       /* Handle backslash character */
01915       if (ch == '\\')
01916         {
01917           ch = Ppeekc (pptr);
01918           /* Add anything except end of line to buffer */
01919           if ((ch != EOF) && (ch != '\n'))
01920             {
01921               ch = Pgetc (pptr);
01922               addc_to_Mbuf (temp_mbuf, ch);
01923             }
01924 
01925         }
01926     }
01927 
01928   string = copy_Mbuf_buf (temp_mbuf);
01929 
01930   return (string);
01931 }
01932 
01933 
01934 
01935 char *
01936 Pget_for_string (Pptr * pptr)
01937 {
01938   int ch, next_ch;
01939   char *string;
01940 
01941   /* Use temp_mbuf to build string */
01942   clear_Mbuf (temp_mbuf);
01943 
01944   /* Skip leading whitespace */
01945   Pskip_whitespace_no_nl (pptr);
01946 
01947   /* Get placemark for error messages */
01948   move_Pptr (temp_placemark, pptr);
01949 
01950   /* If first character is a '{', get hit matching '}' */
01951   if ((ch = Ppeekc (pptr)) == EOF)
01952     Perror (temp_placemark, "String expected, not EOF.");
01953   if (ch == '{')
01954     {
01955       string = Pget_bounded_string (pptr);
01956     }
01957 
01958   /* If quoted string, get quoted string (don't strip quotes) */
01959   else if ((ch == '"') || (ch == '\''))
01960     {
01961       string = Pget_quoted_string (pptr, 0);
01962     }
01963 
01964   /* Get string until next whitespace or ')', 
01965    * Punt if hit quotes in middle of string.
01966    */
01967   else
01968     {
01969       while (1)
01970         {
01971           ch = Ppeekc (pptr);
01972 
01973           if ((ch == EOF) || (ch == ')') || isspace (ch))
01974             break;
01975 
01976           if (ch == '\\')
01977             {
01978               /* Get backslash and next character */
01979               ch = Pgetc (pptr);
01980               next_ch = Ppeekc (pptr);
01981 
01982               if ((next_ch == EOF) || (next_ch == '\n'))
01983                 Perror (pptr, "Character missing after backslash.");
01984 
01985               next_ch = Pgetc (pptr);
01986 
01987               addc_to_Mbuf (temp_mbuf, ch);
01988               addc_to_Mbuf (temp_mbuf, next_ch);
01989 
01990 
01991             }
01992 
01993           /* Error to have quote character in middle of unquoted string */
01994           else if ((ch == '"') || (ch == '\''))
01995             {
01996               Perror (pptr,
01997                       "Unexpected quote.  Expecting one of the following:\n "
01998                       "1) Whitespace before the quote\n 2) or a backslash "
01999                       "before the quote.");
02000 
02001             }
02002 
02003           /* Error to have '(' in middle of unquoted string */
02004           else if (ch == '(')
02005             {
02006               Perror (pptr, "Unexpected '(' in unquoted string.");
02007             }
02008 
02009           /* Error to have '$' without a backslash */
02010           else if (ch == '$')
02011             {
02012               Perror (pptr,
02013                       "Expecting a backslash before '$' in unquoted string.\n"
02014                       "Note: $def, $undef, $for, $if, and $include directives "
02015                       "may not\n   be embedded in replacement value strings.");
02016             }
02017 
02018           else
02019             {
02020               ch = Pgetc (pptr);
02021               addc_to_Mbuf (temp_mbuf, ch);
02022             }
02023         }
02024 
02025       /* Alloc copy of string in temp_buf */
02026       string = copy_Mbuf_buf (temp_mbuf);
02027     }
02028 
02029   return (string);
02030 }
02031 
02032 /* Gets string bounded by { }  */
02033 char *
02034 Pget_bounded_string (Pptr * pptr)
02035 {
02036   int ch;
02037   char *string;
02038   int nesting_level;
02039 
02040   /* Use temp_mbuf to build string */
02041   clear_Mbuf (temp_mbuf);
02042 
02043   /* Skip leading whitespace */
02044   Pskip_whitespace_no_nl (pptr);
02045 
02046   /* Get placemark for error messages */
02047   move_Pptr (temp_placemark, pptr);
02048 
02049   /* If first character is a '{', get hit matching '}' */
02050   if ((ch = Ppeekc (pptr)) == EOF)
02051     Perror (temp_placemark, "String expected, not EOF.");
02052 
02053   if (ch != '{')
02054     L_punt ("Pget_bounded_string: '{' expected not '%c'.", ch);
02055 
02056   /* Skip leading { */
02057   Pgetc (pptr);
02058 
02059   /* Start at nesting depth 1 */
02060   nesting_level = 1;
02061 
02062   while (1)
02063     {
02064       /* Error to have '$' without a backslash */
02065       ch = Ppeekc (pptr);
02066       if (ch == '$')
02067         {
02068           Perror (pptr,
02069                   "Expecting a backslash before '$' in bounded string.\n"
02070                   "Note: $def, $undef, $for, $if, and $include directives "
02071                   "may not\n be embedded in replacement value strings.");
02072         }
02073 
02074       if ((ch = Pgetc (pptr)) == EOF)
02075         Perror (temp_placemark, "End '}' of bounded string not found.");
02076       /* Handle backslashed characters, just add both backslash
02077        * and character to bounded string 
02078        */
02079       if (ch == '\\')
02080         {
02081           addc_to_Mbuf (temp_mbuf, ch);
02082           if ((ch = Pgetc (pptr)) == EOF)
02083             Perror (temp_placemark, "End '}' of bounded string not found.");
02084           addc_to_Mbuf (temp_mbuf, ch);
02085           continue;
02086         }
02087 
02088 
02089       if (ch == '{')
02090         nesting_level++;
02091       else if (ch == '}')
02092         nesting_level--;
02093       /* Do not add trailing '}' */
02094       if (nesting_level <= 0)
02095         break;
02096       addc_to_Mbuf (temp_mbuf, ch);
02097     }
02098 
02099   /* Alloc copy of string in temp_buf */
02100   string = copy_Mbuf_buf (temp_mbuf);
02101   return (string);
02102 }
02103 
02104 void
02105 Pskip_whitespace (Pptr * pptr)
02106 {
02107   int ch;
02108   while ((ch = Ppeekc (pptr)) != EOF)
02109     {
02110       if (isspace (ch))
02111         Pgetc (pptr);
02112       else
02113         break;
02114     }
02115 }
02116 
02117 void
02118 Pskip_whitespace_no_nl (Pptr * pptr)
02119 {
02120   int ch;
02121   while ((ch = Ppeekc (pptr)) != EOF)
02122     {
02123       if ((ch != '\n') && isspace (ch))
02124         Pgetc (pptr);
02125       else
02126         break;
02127     }
02128 }
02129 
02130 
02131 /* Create preprocessed file ptr (pptr) to start of mfile */
02132 Pptr *
02133 create_Pptr (Mfile * mfile)
02134 {
02135   Pptr *pptr;
02136   pptr = (Pptr *) L_alloc (Pptr_pool);
02137   pptr->mptr = create_Mptr (mfile);
02138   pptr->expanded = create_Mbuf ();
02139   pptr->expanded_pos = 0;
02140   pptr->quoted = 0;
02141   pptr->scanned = 0;
02142   return (pptr);
02143 }
02144 
02145 /* Duplicates a Pptr exactly
02146  * Returns the duplicated Pptr (dup must be freed)
02147  */
02148 Pptr *
02149 copy_Pptr (Pptr * orig_pptr)
02150 {
02151   Pptr *new_pptr;
02152   char *orig_expanded;
02153   /* alloc and copy over fields */
02154   new_pptr = (Pptr *) L_alloc (Pptr_pool);
02155   new_pptr->mptr = copy_Mptr (orig_pptr->mptr);
02156   /* Allocate new expanded buffer, and copy over contents */
02157   new_pptr->expanded = create_Mbuf ();
02158   orig_expanded = get_Mbuf_buf (orig_pptr->expanded);
02159   adds_to_Mbuf (new_pptr->expanded, orig_expanded);
02160   new_pptr->expanded_pos = orig_pptr->expanded_pos;
02161   new_pptr->quoted = orig_pptr->quoted;
02162   new_pptr->scanned = orig_pptr->scanned;
02163   return (new_pptr);
02164 }
02165 
02166 /*
02167  * Moves old pptr to new position.
02168  * Used to jump preprocessed file around.
02169  */
02170 void
02171 move_Pptr (Pptr * old_pptr, Pptr * new_pptr)
02172 {
02173   char *new_expanded;
02174   /* Sanity check, may not be the same pointers */
02175   if (old_pptr == new_pptr)
02176     L_punt ("move_Pptr: old_pptr and new_pptr the same.");
02177   move_Mptr (old_pptr->mptr, new_pptr->mptr);
02178   /* Copy over contents of expanded buffer */
02179   clear_Mbuf (old_pptr->expanded);
02180   new_expanded = get_Mbuf_buf (new_pptr->expanded);
02181   adds_to_Mbuf (old_pptr->expanded, new_expanded);
02182   /* Move expanded pointer and state */
02183   old_pptr->expanded_pos = new_pptr->expanded_pos;
02184   old_pptr->quoted = new_pptr->quoted;
02185   old_pptr->scanned = new_pptr->scanned;
02186 }
02187 
02188 void
02189 free_Pptr (Pptr * pptr)
02190 {
02191   /* Free Mptr */
02192   free_Mptr (pptr->mptr);
02193   /* Free expanded buffer */
02194   free_Mbuf (pptr->expanded);
02195   /* L_free structure */
02196   L_free (Pptr_pool, pptr);
02197 }
02198 
02199 /* Expands a preprocessor directive (if applicable), or just puts 
02200  * $ in expanded buffer.
02201  */
02202 void
02203 Pexpand_directive (Pptr * source_pptr)
02204 {
02205   int ch, next_ch, end_ch;
02206   Pptr *expand_pptr;
02207   Mbuf *expand_mbuf;
02208   int range_start, range_end;
02209   int int_result;
02210   double double_result;
02211   char rbuf[100];
02212   char *recurse_buf;
02213   char *ident, *replacement;
02214   int i;
02215   /* Get a copy of the source_pptr for recursion to do calculation */
02216   expand_pptr = copy_Pptr (source_pptr);
02217   /* Add the entry $ to buffer and consume it by incrementing pos */
02218   addc_to_Mbuf (expand_pptr->expanded, '$');
02219   expand_pptr->expanded_pos += 1;
02220   /* Peek at next character to determine type of directive (if next
02221    * character is not a backslash (otherwise will cause infinite
02222    * recursion))
02223    */
02224   if ((next_ch = Mpeekc (expand_pptr->mptr)) != '\\')
02225     {
02226       next_ch = Ppeekc (expand_pptr);
02227     }
02228 
02229   /* Handle evaluate integer expression preprocessor directive */
02230   if ((next_ch == '=') && allow_text_replacement)
02231     {
02232       /* Get the '=' */
02233       Pgetc (expand_pptr);
02234       /* Expect '{' after '=' */
02235       if (Ppeekc (expand_pptr) != '{')
02236         {
02237           Perror (expand_pptr,
02238                   "Expecting '{' after '$=' in 'evaluate integer expression' "
02239                   "directive.\nForm expected: $={integer expression}.");
02240         }
02241       /* Get the '{' */
02242       Pgetc (expand_pptr);
02243       /* Get value of expression */
02244       int_result = Pcalc_C_int_expr (expand_pptr, 0);
02245       /* Expect '}' at end of expression */
02246       Pskip_whitespace (expand_pptr);
02247       if ((end_ch = Ppeekc (expand_pptr)) != '}')
02248         {
02249           if ((end_ch == 'e') || (end_ch == 'E') || (end_ch == '.'))
02250             {
02251               Perror (expand_pptr,
02252                       "Expression error or missing '}' in 'evaulate int "
02253                       "expression' directive.\n"
02254                       "Form expected: $={integer expression}.\n\n"
02255                       "For floating-point expressions use: "
02256                       "$.={floating-point expression}.");
02257             }
02258           else
02259             {
02260               Perror (expand_pptr,
02261                       "Expression error or missing '}' in 'evaulate int "
02262                       "expression' directive.\n"
02263                       "Form expected: $={integer expression}.");
02264             }
02265         }
02266       /* Get the '{' */
02267       Pgetc (expand_pptr);
02268       /* Move source_pptr's mptr to after calculation using expand_pptr */
02269       move_Mptr (source_pptr->mptr, expand_pptr->mptr);
02270       /* Write result to source_pptr's expanded buffer */
02271       sprintf (rbuf, "%i", int_result);
02272       adds_to_Mbuf (source_pptr->expanded, rbuf);
02273       /* Copy rest of expansion text to expand buffer */
02274       recurse_buf = get_Mbuf_buf (expand_pptr->expanded);
02275       adds_to_Mbuf (source_pptr->expanded,
02276                     &recurse_buf[expand_pptr->expanded_pos]);}
02277 
02278   /* Handle evaluate floating-point expression preprocessor directive */
02279   else if ((next_ch == '.') && allow_text_replacement)
02280     {
02281       /* Get the '.' */
02282       Pgetc (expand_pptr);
02283       /* Expect '=' after '.' */
02284       if (Ppeekc (expand_pptr) != '=')
02285         {
02286           Perror (expand_pptr,
02287                   "Expecting '=' after '$.' in 'evaluate float expression' "
02288                   "directive.\nForm expected: $.={floating-point expression}.");
02289         }
02290       /* Get the '=' */
02291       Pgetc (expand_pptr);
02292       /* Expect '{' after '.=' */
02293       if (Ppeekc (expand_pptr) != '{')
02294         {
02295           Perror (expand_pptr,
02296                   "Expecting '{' after '$.=' in 'evaluate float expression' "
02297                   "directive.\nForm expected: $.={floating-point expression}.");
02298         }
02299       /* Get the '{' */
02300       Pgetc (expand_pptr);
02301       /* Get value of expression */
02302       double_result = Pcalc_C_float_expr (expand_pptr, 0);
02303       /* Expect '}' at end of expression */
02304       Pskip_whitespace (expand_pptr);
02305       if (Ppeekc (expand_pptr) != '}')
02306         {
02307           Perror (expand_pptr,
02308                   "Expression error or missing '}' in 'evaulate float "
02309                   "expression' directive.\nForm expected: $.={floating-point "
02310                   "expression}.");
02311         }
02312       /* Get the '{' */
02313       Pgetc (expand_pptr);
02314       /* Move source_pptr's mptr to after calculation using expand_pptr */
02315       move_Mptr (source_pptr->mptr, expand_pptr->mptr);
02316       /* Write result to source_pptr's expanded buffer */
02317       sprintf (rbuf, "%.16g", double_result);
02318       adds_to_Mbuf (source_pptr->expanded, rbuf);
02319       /* Copy rest of expansion text to expand buffer */
02320       recurse_buf = get_Mbuf_buf (expand_pptr->expanded);
02321       adds_to_Mbuf (source_pptr->expanded,
02322                     &recurse_buf[expand_pptr->expanded_pos]);}
02323 
02324   /* Handle 'is defined' directive I.e., $?{name} */
02325   else if ((next_ch == '?') && allow_text_replacement)
02326     {
02327       /* Disable implicit text replacement so that the identifier between
02328        * ${} will not be replaced with its value unless explicitly told
02329        * to do so.
02330        */
02331       disable_implicit_text_replacement++;
02332       /* Get the '?' */
02333       Pgetc (expand_pptr);
02334       /* Expect '{' after '?' */
02335       if (Ppeekc (expand_pptr) != '{')
02336         {
02337           Perror (expand_pptr,
02338                   "Expecting '{' after '$?' in 'is defined?' directive.\n"
02339                   "Form expected: $?{name}.");
02340         }
02341 
02342       /* Get the '{' */
02343       Pgetc (expand_pptr);
02344       /* Allocate mbuf to build identifier */
02345       expand_mbuf = create_Mbuf ();
02346       /* Get the string until the matching right curly bracket */
02347       while ((ch = Ppeekc (expand_pptr)) != '}')
02348         {
02349           if ((ch == EOF) || (ch == '\n'))
02350             Merror (source_pptr->mptr,
02351                     "Text replacement directive's end '}' not found.");
02352           /* Make reasonably sure valid identifier */
02353           if ((ch == '_') || isalnum (ch))
02354             {
02355               /* Get the character and place in buffer */
02356               ch = Pgetc (expand_pptr);
02357               addc_to_Mbuf (expand_mbuf, ch);
02358             }
02359           else
02360             {
02361               Perror (expand_pptr,
02362                       "Invalid character '%c' in 'is defined?' directive.",
02363                       ch);}
02364         }
02365 
02366       /* Get pointer to identifier buffer */
02367       ident = get_Mbuf_buf (expand_mbuf);
02368       /* If text replacement exists, replace directive with '1' */
02369       if ((replacement = Plookup (ident, 0)) != NULL)
02370         addc_to_Mbuf (source_pptr->expanded, '1');
02371       /* Otherwise, '0' */
02372       else
02373         {
02374           addc_to_Mbuf (source_pptr->expanded, '0');
02375         }
02376 
02377       /* Free expand mbuf */
02378       free_Mbuf (expand_mbuf);
02379       /* Restore original value of disable_implicit_text_replacement */
02380       disable_implicit_text_replacement--;
02381       /* Get the right curly bracket */
02382       Pgetc (expand_pptr);
02383       /* Move source_mptr to where expand_pptr->mptr is now */
02384       move_Mptr (source_pptr->mptr, expand_pptr->mptr);
02385     }
02386 
02387   /* Handle range expansion.  Ie. $0..10 */
02388   else
02389     if (
02390         (isdigit (next_ch) || (next_ch == '-')
02391          || (next_ch == '+') || (next_ch == '(')) && allow_text_replacement)
02392     {
02393       /* Get the start of the range.
02394        * Use Pcalc_C_int_factor instead of Pcalc_C_int_expr so that only 
02395        * integers and parenthetical expressions are allowed.
02396        * Using Pcalc_C_int_expr cause it to consume trailing negative 
02397        * numbers.
02398        */
02399       range_start = Pcalc_C_int_factor (expand_pptr);
02400       /* Skip whitespace and make sure next two characters are '..' */
02401       Pskip_whitespace (expand_pptr);
02402       /* Peek at each '.' in range expression so error message goes
02403        * in correct place.
02404        */
02405       if ((Ppeekc (expand_pptr) != '.')
02406           || (Pgetc (expand_pptr) != '.')
02407           || (Ppeekc (expand_pptr) != '.') || (Pgetc (expand_pptr) != '.'))
02408         Perror (expand_pptr,
02409                 "Error in range expression: '..' expected between start and "
02410                 "end range.");
02411       /* Skip whitespace before end range */
02412       Pskip_whitespace (expand_pptr);
02413       /* Use Pcalc_C_int_factor instead of Pcalc_C_int_expr so that only 
02414        * integers and parenthetical expressions are allowed.
02415        * Using Pcalc_C_int_expr cause it to consume trailing negative 
02416        * numbers.
02417        */
02418       range_end = Pcalc_C_int_factor (expand_pptr);
02419       /* For now */
02420       if (range_start <= range_end)
02421         {
02422           for (i = range_start; i <= range_end; i++)
02423             {
02424               sprintf (rbuf, "%i", i);
02425               adds_to_Mbuf (source_pptr->expanded, rbuf);
02426               if (i < range_end)
