02427                 addc_to_Mbuf (source_pptr->expanded, ' ');
02428             }
02429         }
02430       else
02431         {
02432           for (i = range_start; i >= range_end; i--)
02433             {
02434               sprintf (rbuf, "%i", i);
02435               adds_to_Mbuf (source_pptr->expanded, rbuf);
02436               if (i > range_end)
02437                 addc_to_Mbuf (source_pptr->expanded, ' ');
02438             }
02439         }
02440 
02441       /* Move source_pptr's mptr to after calculation using expand_pptr */
02442       move_Mptr (source_pptr->mptr, expand_pptr->mptr);
02443       /* Copy rest of expansion text to expand buffer */
02444       recurse_buf = get_Mbuf_buf (expand_pptr->expanded);
02445       adds_to_Mbuf (source_pptr->expanded,
02446                     &recurse_buf[expand_pptr->expanded_pos]);}
02447 
02448   /* Handle substitution directives */
02449   else if ((next_ch == '{') && allow_text_replacement)
02450     {
02451       /* Disable implicit text replacement so that the identifier between
02452        * ${} will not be replaced with its value unless explicitly told
02453        * to do so.
02454        */
02455       disable_implicit_text_replacement++;
02456       /* Get the left curly bracket */
02457       Pgetc (expand_pptr);
02458       /* Allocate mbuf to build identifier */
02459       expand_mbuf = create_Mbuf ();
02460       /* Get the string until the matching right curly bracket */
02461       while ((ch = Ppeekc (expand_pptr)) != '}')
02462         {
02463           if ((ch == EOF) || (ch == '\n'))
02464             Merror (source_pptr->mptr,
02465                     "Text replacement directive's end '}' not found.");
02466           /* Make reasonably sure valid identifier */
02467           if ((ch == '_') || isalnum (ch))
02468             {
02469               /* Get the character and place in buffer */
02470               ch = Pgetc (expand_pptr);
02471               addc_to_Mbuf (expand_mbuf, ch);
02472             }
02473 
02474           else
02475             {
02476               Perror (expand_pptr,
02477                       "Invalid character '%c' in text replacement directive.",
02478                       ch);}
02479         }
02480 
02481 
02482       /* Get pointer to identifier buffer */
02483       ident = get_Mbuf_buf (expand_mbuf);
02484       /* Replace text if exists otherwise punt 
02485        * (in future, allow environment search also)
02486        */
02487       if ((replacement = Plookup (ident, 0)) != NULL)
02488         adds_to_Mbuf (source_pptr->expanded, replacement);
02489       else
02490         {
02491           Perror (expand_pptr,
02492                   "Undefined name '%s' in text replacement directive.",
02493                   ident);}
02494 
02495       /* Free expand mbuf */
02496       free_Mbuf (expand_mbuf);
02497       /* Restore original value of disable_implicit_text_replacement */
02498       disable_implicit_text_replacement--;
02499       /* Get the right curly bracket */
02500       Pgetc (expand_pptr);
02501       /* Move source_mptr to where expand_pptr->mptr is now */
02502       move_Mptr (source_pptr->mptr, expand_pptr->mptr);
02503     }
02504 
02505   /* Handle $\ , to prevent preprocessing of a name 
02506    * Special case, work directly with mptr because do not
02507    * want any preprocessing of next character
02508    */
02509   else if (next_ch == '\\')
02510     /* Handle even when not doing text replacement */
02511     {
02512       /* Get backslash */
02513       Mgetc (source_pptr->mptr);
02514       /* Peek at next character, if newline, consume newline,
02515        * otherwise, flag that next character has been scanned
02516        * (prevents text replacement of next identifier).
02517        */
02518       if (Mpeekc (source_pptr->mptr) == '\n')
02519         Mgetc (source_pptr->mptr);
02520       else
02521         {
02522           /* Flag that remaining text has already been scanned */
02523           source_pptr->scanned = 1;
02524         }
02525     }
02526   /* Otherwise, just put $ in expanded buffer */
02527   else
02528     {
02529       addc_to_Mbuf (source_pptr->expanded, '$');
02530     }
02531 
02532   /* Free expansion Pptr, not needed after expansion */
02533   free_Pptr (expand_pptr);
02534 }
02535 
02536 /* Expands the file text, as necessary to allow processing of the next
02537  * preprocessed character in the file.
02538  * 
02539  * Returns 1 if successful (may have done nothing), 0 if at EOF.
02540  */
02541 int
02542 Pexpand_text (Pptr * pptr)
02543 {
02544   char ch, next_ch, first_ch;
02545   Mptr *mptr;
02546   char *ident, *replacement;
02547   char nesting_level;
02548   /* Get mptr from pptr for ease of use */
02549   mptr = pptr->mptr;
02550   /* Loop until there is something for the caller to process
02551    * at pptr->expanded_pos.
02552    * Do nothing if already something there on entry.
02553    */
02554   while (pptr->expanded->cur_len <= pptr->expanded_pos)
02555     {
02556 
02557       /* If at start of new line, clear expanded buf */
02558       if (Mptr_pos (mptr) == 0)
02559         {
02560           /* Clear expanded text, starting processing of new line */
02561           clear_Mbuf (pptr->expanded);
02562           pptr->expanded_pos = 0;
02563           /* End processing of quoted text if hit end of line */
02564           pptr->quoted = 0;
02565         }
02566 
02567       /* Get the next character from the file, return 0 at EOF */
02568       if ((ch = Mgetc (mptr)) == '\0')
02569         return (0);
02570       /* If it is not a alnum or _ then we have not scanned it yet */
02571       if ((ch != '_') && !isalnum (ch))
02572         {
02573           pptr->scanned = 0;
02574         }
02575 
02576       /* If not in quoted text or text we have already scanned then: 
02577        *   if start of identifier, read in identifier and do
02578        *   text replacement if necessary.
02579        */
02580       if ((!pptr->quoted) && (!pptr->scanned) &&
02581           ((ch == '_') || isalpha (ch)))
02582         {
02583           /* Set placemark so can rewind if not do not do text replacement */
02584           move_Mptr (expand_placemark, mptr);
02585           first_ch = ch;
02586           /* Use pptr_mbuf to build identifier */
02587           clear_Mbuf (pptr_mbuf);
02588           addc_to_Mbuf (pptr_mbuf, ch);
02589           /* Get rest of identifier */
02590           while ((ch = Mpeekc (mptr)) != EOF)
02591             {
02592               if ((ch == '_') || isalnum (ch))
02593                 {
02594                   ch = Mgetc (mptr);
02595                   addc_to_Mbuf (pptr_mbuf, ch);
02596                 }
02597               else
02598                 break;
02599             }
02600 
02601           /* Get pointer to identifier buffer */
02602           ident = get_Mbuf_buf (pptr_mbuf);
02603           /* Use replacement text if exists, 
02604            * otherwise rewind and put first character in expand text
02605            * and set scanned flag.
02606            */
02607           if (allow_text_replacement &&
02608               (disable_implicit_text_replacement == 0) &&
02609               (replacement = Plookup (ident, 1)) != NULL)
02610             adds_to_Mbuf (pptr->expanded, replacement);
02611           else
02612             {
02613               move_Mptr (mptr, expand_placemark);
02614               pptr->scanned = 1;
02615               addc_to_Mbuf (pptr->expanded, first_ch);
02616             }
02617         }
02618 
02619       /* If not in quoted text,
02620        * Handle calculation directives .
02621        * (later substitution directives)
02622        */
02623       else if ((!pptr->quoted) && (ch == '$'))
02624         {
02625           Pexpand_directive (pptr);
02626         }
02627 
02628       /* Handle slashes and comments */
02629       else if (ch == '/')
02630         {
02631           /* Look at the next character to see what to do
02632            * will be EOF if at end of file
02633            */
02634           ch = Mpeekc (mptr);
02635           /* Handle C++ line comments */
02636           if (ch == '/')
02637             {
02638               /* Consume file until hit newline (leaving it there)
02639                * or hit EOF.
02640                */
02641               while ((ch = Mpeekc (mptr)) != EOF)
02642                 {
02643                   if (ch == '\n')
02644                     break;
02645                   Mgetc (mptr);
02646                 }
02647             }
02648           /* Handle C (possibly nested) comments */
02649           else if (ch == '*')
02650             {
02651               /* Set placemark  for error messages */
02652               move_Mptr (expand_placemark, mptr);
02653               /* Consume '*' */
02654               Mgetc (mptr);
02655               /* Consume the comment until hit end comment */
02656               nesting_level = 1;
02657               while (nesting_level > 0)
02658                 {
02659                   if ((ch = Mgetc (mptr)) == EOF)
02660                     Merror (expand_placemark, "End of comment not found.");
02661                   /* Peek at next character to detect start/end comment
02662                    * delimiters.
02663                    */
02664                   next_ch = Mpeekc (mptr);
02665                   /* Handle backslashes */
02666                   if (ch == '\\')
02667                     {
02668                       /* Consume next character without looking at it */
02669                       Mgetc (mptr);
02670                     }
02671 
02672 
02673                   /* Detect start commment delimiter */
02674                   if ((ch == '/') && (next_ch == '*'))
02675                     {
02676                       /* Consume '*' */
02677                       Mgetc (mptr);
02678                       nesting_level++;
02679                     }
02680 
02681                   /* Detect end comment delimiter */
02682                   if ((ch == '*') && (next_ch == '/'))
02683                     {
02684                       /* Consume '/' */
02685                       Mgetc (mptr);
02686                       nesting_level--;
02687                     }
02688                 }
02689             }
02690 
02691           /* Otherwise, just add / */
02692           else
02693             {
02694               addc_to_Mbuf (pptr->expanded, '/');
02695             }
02696         }
02697 
02698       /* Otherwise, add character to expanded buffer */
02699       else
02700         {
02701           addc_to_Mbuf (pptr->expanded, ch);
02702           /* Do not preprocess single quoted strings,
02703            * Maintain quoted flag state (to prevent text processing above)
02704            */
02705           if (ch == '\'')
02706             {
02707               if (pptr->quoted)
02708                 pptr->quoted = 0;
02709               else
02710                 pptr->quoted = 1;
02711             }
02712 
02713           /* If have backslash, add next character newline or at EOF */
02714           else if (ch == '\\')
02715             {
02716               ch = Mpeekc (mptr);
02717               if ((ch != '\n') && (ch != EOF))
02718                 {
02719                   ch = Mgetc (mptr);
02720                   addc_to_Mbuf (pptr->expanded, ch);
02721                 }
02722             }
02723         }
02724     }
02725 
02726   /* Success, return 1 */
02727   return (1);
02728 }
02729 
02730 /* Gets the next preprocessed character from the file. */
02731 int
02732 Pgetc (Pptr * pptr)
02733 {
02734   int ch;
02735   char *expanded_buf;
02736   /* If not at end of expanded text, get next character */
02737   if (Pexpand_text (pptr))
02738     {
02739       /* Get next character from the expanded buffer */
02740       expanded_buf = get_Mbuf_buf (pptr->expanded);
02741       ch = expanded_buf[pptr->expanded_pos];
02742       pptr->expanded_pos++;
02743     }
02744 
02745   /* Otherwise, at EOF return EOF */
02746   else
02747     {
02748       ch = EOF;
02749     }
02750   return (ch);
02751 }
02752 
02753 /* Peeks at the next character to be returned */
02754 int
02755 Ppeekc (Pptr * pptr)
02756 {
02757   int ch;
02758   char *expanded_buf;
02759   /* If not at end of expanded text, get next character */
02760   if (Pexpand_text (pptr))
02761     {
02762       /* Peek at Get next character from the expanded buffer */
02763       expanded_buf = get_Mbuf_buf (pptr->expanded);
02764       ch = expanded_buf[pptr->expanded_pos];
02765     }
02766 
02767   /* Otherwise, at EOF return EOF */
02768   else
02769     ch = EOF;
02770   return (ch);
02771 }
02772 
02773 /* Calculates the value of an integer C expression using any non-assignment 
02774  * operation in C.  Start with a current_precedence of 0.
02775  */
02776 int
02777 Pcalc_C_int_expr (Pptr * pptr, int current_precedence)
02778 {
02779   int result;
02780   int ch, ch2;
02781   int unary_operator;
02782   int temp_result;
02783   Pptr *placemark;
02784   /* Detect unary operators before first factor */
02785   Pskip_whitespace (pptr);
02786   ch = Ppeekc (pptr);
02787   if ((ch == '!') || (ch == '~'))
02788     {
02789       /* Get unary operator and skip whitespace until next character */
02790       unary_operator = ch;
02791       Pgetc (pptr);
02792       Pskip_whitespace (pptr);
02793       ch = Ppeekc (pptr);
02794     }
02795   else
02796     unary_operator = 0;
02797   /* Get the first factor */
02798   result = Pcalc_C_int_factor (pptr);
02799   /* Processor unary operator (if any) */
02800   if (unary_operator != 0)
02801     {
02802       switch (unary_operator)
02803         {
02804         case '!':
02805           result = !result;
02806           break;
02807         case '~':
02808           result = ~result;
02809           break;
02810         default:
02811           Perror (pptr,
02812                   "Algorithm error: undefined unary operator '%c'.",
02813                   unary_operator);}
02814     }
02815 
02816   /* Allocate placemark because can be recursively called in 
02817    * inner loop.
02818    */
02819   placemark = copy_Pptr (pptr);
02820   /* Add/Sub trace remaining terms */
02821   while (1)
02822     {
02823       /* Move placemark to current pos so can rewind if at end of expr */
02824       move_Pptr (placemark, pptr);
02825       Pskip_whitespace (pptr);
02826       /* Get next potential token and peek at character after it for
02827        * two character tokens 
02828        */
02829       ch = Pgetc (pptr);
02830       ch2 = Ppeekc (pptr);
02831       /* Process token if token matches and current level of predecence
02832        * is lower than the tokens precedence.
02833        * 
02834        * Check two character tokens first before one character tokens
02835        */
02836       /* 
02837        * Check two character tokens
02838        */
02839       if ((ch == '<') && (ch2 == '<') && (current_precedence < 11))
02840         {
02841           /* Consume second character of token */
02842           Pgetc (pptr);
02843           result = result << Pcalc_C_int_expr (pptr, 11);
02844         }
02845 
02846       else if ((ch == '>') && (ch2 == '>') && (current_precedence < 11))
02847         {
02848           /* Consume second character of token */
02849           Pgetc (pptr);
02850           result = result >> Pcalc_C_int_expr (pptr, 11);
02851         }
02852 
02853       else if ((ch == '<') && (ch2 == '=') && (current_precedence < 10))
02854         {
02855           /* Consume second character of token */
02856           Pgetc (pptr);
02857           result = result <= Pcalc_C_int_expr (pptr, 10);
02858         }
02859 
02860       else if ((ch == '>') && (ch2 == '=') && (current_precedence < 10))
02861         {
02862           /* Consume second character of token */
02863           Pgetc (pptr);
02864           result = result >= Pcalc_C_int_expr (pptr, 10);
02865         }
02866 
02867       else if ((ch == '=') && (ch2 == '=') && (current_precedence < 9))
02868         {
02869           /* Consume second character of token */
02870           Pgetc (pptr);
02871           result = result == Pcalc_C_int_expr (pptr, 9);
02872         }
02873 
02874       else if ((ch == '!') && (ch2 == '=') && (current_precedence < 9))
02875         {
02876           /* Consume second character of token */
02877           Pgetc (pptr);
02878           result = result != Pcalc_C_int_expr (pptr, 9);
02879         }
02880 
02881       else if ((ch == '&') && (ch2 == '&') && (current_precedence < 5))
02882         {
02883           /* Consume second character of token */
02884           Pgetc (pptr);
02885           /* Get RHS of && into temp, because C short circutes evaluation */
02886           temp_result = Pcalc_C_int_expr (pptr, 5);
02887           result = result && temp_result;
02888         }
02889 
02890       else if ((ch == '|') && (ch2 == '|') && (current_precedence < 4))
02891         {
02892           /* Consume second character of token */
02893           Pgetc (pptr);
02894           /* Get RHS of || into temp, because C short circutes evaluation */
02895           temp_result = Pcalc_C_int_expr (pptr, 4);
02896           result = result || temp_result;
02897         }
02898 
02899       /* 
02900        * Now check one character tokens 
02901        */
02902 
02903       else if ((ch == '*') && (current_precedence < 13))
02904         result = result * Pcalc_C_int_expr (pptr, 13);
02905       else if ((ch == '/') && (current_precedence < 13))
02906         {
02907           /* Detect divide by zero */
02908           temp_result = Pcalc_C_int_expr (pptr, 13);
02909           if (temp_result == 0)
02910             Perror (pptr, "Expression attempts to divide by zero.");
02911           result = result / temp_result;
02912         }
02913 
02914       else if ((ch == '%') && (current_precedence < 13))
02915         result = result % Pcalc_C_int_expr (pptr, 13);
02916       else if ((ch == '+') && (current_precedence < 12))
02917         result = result + Pcalc_C_int_expr (pptr, 12);
02918       else if ((ch == '-') && (current_precedence < 12))
02919         result = result - Pcalc_C_int_expr (pptr, 12);
02920       else if ((ch == '<') && (current_precedence < 10))
02921         result = result < Pcalc_C_int_expr (pptr, 10);
02922       else if ((ch == '>') && (current_precedence < 10))
02923         result = result > Pcalc_C_int_expr (pptr, 10);
02924       /* Must check second char since first char alone higher prededence 
02925        * than &&
02926        */
02927       else if ((ch == '&') && (ch2 != '&') && (current_precedence < 8))
02928         result = result & Pcalc_C_int_expr (pptr, 8);
02929       else if ((ch == '^') && (current_precedence < 7))
02930         result = result ^ Pcalc_C_int_expr (pptr, 7);
02931       /* Must check second char since first char alone higher prededence 
02932        * than ||
02933        */
02934       else if ((ch == '|') && (ch2 != '|') && (current_precedence < 6))
02935         result = result | Pcalc_C_int_expr (pptr, 6);
02936       else
02937         {
02938           /* Go back to placemark position before returning */
02939           move_Pptr (pptr, placemark);
02940           break;
02941         }
02942     }
02943 
02944   /* Free placemark */
02945   free_Pptr (placemark);
02946   return (result);
02947 }
02948 
02949 int
02950 Pcalc_C_int_factor (Pptr * pptr)
02951 {
02952   int result = 0;
02953   int ch, sign_operator;
02954   Pptr *placemark;
02955   Pskip_whitespace (pptr);
02956   ch = Ppeekc (pptr);
02957   /* Detect sign operators */
02958   if ((ch == '-') || (ch == '+'))
02959     {
02960       /* Get sign operator and skip whitespace until next character */
02961       sign_operator = ch;
02962       Pgetc (pptr);
02963       Pskip_whitespace (pptr);
02964       ch = Ppeekc (pptr);
02965     }
02966   else
02967     sign_operator = 0;
02968   /* Handle numbers */
02969   if (isdigit (ch))
02970     {
02971       /* Get first number */
02972       ch = Pgetc (pptr);
02973       result = ch - '0';
02974       /* Detect Octal and Hex numbers (not currently supported) */
02975       if (ch == '0')
02976         {
02977           ch = Ppeekc (pptr);
02978           if (isdigit (ch))
02979             {
02980               Perror (pptr,
02981                       "Octal representation (numbers with 0 prefix) not "
02982                       "supported in expressions.");
02983             }
02984           else if ((ch == 'x') || (ch == 'X'))
02985             {
02986               Perror (pptr,
02987                       "Hex representation (numbers with 0x prefix) not "
02988                       "supported in expressions.");}
02989         }
02990 
02991       /* Allocate placemark, since can be recursively called 
02992        * inside loop.
02993        */
02994       placemark = copy_Pptr (pptr);
02995       /* Get remaining digits */
02996       while (1)
02997         {
02998           /* Get placemark so can restore if not a character */
02999           move_Pptr (placemark, pptr);
03000           /* Get and process character */
03001           ch = Ppeekc (pptr);
03002           if (isdigit (ch))
03003             {
03004               ch = Pgetc (pptr);
03005               result = (result * 10) + (ch - '0');
03006             }
03007           else
03008             {
03009               /* Restore to right after number */
03010               move_Pptr (pptr, placemark);
03011               break;
03012             }
03013         }
03014 
03015       free_Pptr (placemark);
03016     }
03017 
03018   /* Handle parenthesis */
03019   else if (ch == '(')
03020     {
03021       /* Get '(', get internal expression value, and ending ')' */
03022       Pgetc (pptr);
03023       result = Pcalc_C_int_expr (pptr, 0);
03024       Pskip_whitespace (pptr);
03025       if ((ch = Ppeekc (pptr)) == ')')
03026         Pgetc (pptr);
03027       else
03028         {
03029           if ((ch == 'e') || (ch == 'E') || (ch == '.'))
03030             {
03031               Perror (pptr,
03032                       "Integer expression error: ')' expected.\n\n"
03033                       "For floating-point expressions use: "
03034                       "$.={floating-point expression}.");}
03035           else
03036             {
03037               Perror (pptr, "Integer expression error: ')' expected.");
03038             }
03039         }
03040     }
03041 
03042   else
03043     {
03044       if (sign_operator != 0)
03045         {
03046           if (ch == '.')
03047             {
03048               Perror (pptr,
03049                       "Integer expression error:\n"
03050                       "   integer or '(' expected.\n\n"
03051                       "For floating-point expressions use the following form:\n"
03052                       "   $.={floating-point expression}.");}
03053           else
03054             {
03055               Perror (pptr,
03056                       "Integer expression error:\n"
03057                       "   integer or '(' expected.");}
03058         }
03059       else
03060         {
03061           if (ch == '.')
03062             {
03063               Perror (pptr,
03064                       "Integer expression error:\n"
03065                       "    integer , '(', or sign (-, +) expected.\n\n"
03066                       "For floating-point expressions use the following form:\n"
03067                       "   $.={floating-point expression}.");}
03068           else
03069             {
03070               Perror (pptr,
03071                       "Integer expression error:\n"
03072                       "    integer , '(', or sign (-, +) expected.");}
03073         }
03074 
03075     }
03076 
03077   if (sign_operator != 0)
03078     {
03079       switch (sign_operator)
03080         {
03081         case '-':
03082           result = -result;
03083           break;
03084         case '+':
03085           break;
03086         default:
03087           Perror (pptr,
03088                   "Algorithm error: undefined sign operator '%c'.",
03089                   sign_operator);}
03090     }
03091 
03092 
03093   return (result);
03094 }
03095 
03096 
03097 
03098 /* Calculates the value of an floating-point C expression using any 
03099  * non-assignment operation in C.  Start with a current_precedence of 0.
03100  */
03101 double
03102 Pcalc_C_float_expr (Pptr * pptr, int current_precedence)
03103 {
03104   double result;
03105   int ch, ch2;
03106   int unary_operator = 0;
03107   double temp_result;
03108   Pptr *placemark;
03109   /* Detect unary operators before first factor */
03110   Pskip_whitespace (pptr);
03111   ch = Ppeekc (pptr);
03112   if (ch == '!')
03113     {
03114       /* Get unary operator and skip whitespace until next character */
03115       unary_operator = ch;
03116       Pgetc (pptr);
03117       Pskip_whitespace (pptr);
03118       ch = Ppeekc (pptr);
03119     }
03120   else if (ch == '~')
03121     {
03122       Perror (pptr, "'~' not supported in floating point expressions.");
03123     }
03124   else
03125     unary_operator = 0;
03126   /* Get the first factor */
03127   result = Pcalc_C_float_factor (pptr);
03128   /* Processor unary operator (if any) */
03129   if (unary_operator != 0)
03130     {
03131       switch (unary_operator)
03132         {
03133         case '!':
03134           result = !result;
03135           break;
03136         default:
03137           Perror (pptr,
03138                   "Algorithm error: undefined unary operator '%c'.",
03139                   unary_operator);}
03140     }
03141 
03142   /* Allocate placemark because can be recursively called in 
03143    * inner loop.
03144    */
03145   placemark = copy_Pptr (pptr);
03146   /* Add/Sub trace remaining terms */
03147   while (1)
03148     {
03149       /* Move placemark to current pos so can rewind if at end of expr */
03150       move_Pptr (placemark, pptr);
03151       Pskip_whitespace (pptr);
03152       /* Get next potential token and peek at character after it for
03153        * two character tokens 
03154        */
03155       ch = Pgetc (pptr);
03156       ch2 = Ppeekc (pptr);
03157       /* Process token if token matches and current level of predecence
03158        * is lower than the tokens precedence.
03159        * 
03160        * Check two character tokens first before one character tokens
03161        */
03162       /* 
03163        * Check two character tokens
03164        */
03165       if ((ch == '<') && (ch2 == '<') && (current_precedence < 11))
03166         {
03167           Perror (pptr, "'<<' not supported in floating point expressions.");
03168         }
03169 
03170       else if ((ch == '>') && (ch2 == '>') && (current_precedence < 11))
03171         {
03172           Perror (pptr, "'>>' not supported in floating point expressions.");
03173         }
03174 
03175       else if ((ch == '<') && (ch2 == '=') && (current_precedence < 10))
03176         {
03177           /* Consume second character of token */
03178           Pgetc (pptr);
03179           result = result <= Pcalc_C_float_expr (pptr, 10);
03180         }
03181 
03182       else if ((ch == '>') && (ch2 == '=') && (current_precedence < 10))
03183         {
03184           /* Consume second character of token */
03185           Pgetc (pptr);
03186           result = result >= Pcalc_C_float_expr (pptr, 10);
03187         }
03188 
03189       else if ((ch == '=') && (ch2 == '=') && (current_precedence < 9))
03190         {
03191           /* Consume second character of token */
03192           Pgetc (pptr);
03193           result = result == Pcalc_C_float_expr (pptr, 9);
03194         }
03195 
03196       else if ((ch == '!') && (ch2 == '=') && (current_precedence < 9))
03197         {
03198           /* Consume second character of token */
03199           Pgetc (pptr);
03200           result = result != Pcalc_C_float_expr (pptr, 9);
03201         }
03202 
03203       else if ((ch == '&') && (ch2 == '&') && (current_precedence < 5))
03204         {
03205           /* Consume second character of token */
03206           Pgetc (pptr);
03207           /* Get RHS of && into temp, because C short circutes evaluation */
03208           temp_result = Pcalc_C_float_expr (pptr, 5);
03209           result = result && temp_result;
03210         }
03211 
03212       else if ((ch == '|') && (ch2 == '|') && (current_precedence < 4))
03213         {
03214           /* Consume second character of token */
03215           Pgetc (pptr);
03216           /* Get RHS of || into temp, because C short circutes evaluation */
03217           temp_result = Pcalc_C_float_expr (pptr, 4);
03218           result = result || temp_result;
03219         }
03220 
03221       /* 
03222        * Now check one character tokens 
03223        */
03224 
03225       else if ((ch == '*') && (current_precedence < 13))
03226         result = result * Pcalc_C_float_expr (pptr, 13);
03227       else if ((ch == '/') && (current_precedence < 13))
03228         {
03229           /* Detect divide by zero */
03230           temp_result = Pcalc_C_float_expr (pptr, 13);
03231           if (temp_result == 0.0)
03232             Perror (pptr, "Float expression attempts to divide by zero.");
03233           result = result / temp_result;
03234         }
03235 
03236       else if ((ch == '%') && (current_precedence < 13))
03237         Perror (pptr, "'%' not supported in floating point expressions.");
03238       else if ((ch == '+') && (current_precedence < 12))
03239         result = result + Pcalc_C_float_expr (pptr, 12);
03240       else if ((ch == '-') && (current_precedence < 12))
03241         result = result - Pcalc_C_float_expr (pptr, 12);
03242       else if ((ch == '<') && (current_precedence < 10))
03243         result = result < Pcalc_C_float_expr (pptr, 10);
03244       else if ((ch == '>') && (current_precedence < 10))
03245         result = result > Pcalc_C_float_expr (pptr, 10);
03246       /* Must check second char since first char alone higher prededence 
03247        * than &&
03248        */
03249       else if ((ch == '&') && (ch2 != '&') && (current_precedence < 8))
03250         Perror (pptr, "'&' not supported in floating point expressions.");
03251       else if ((ch == '^') && (current_precedence < 7))
03252         Perror (pptr, "'^' not supported in floating point expressions.");
03253       /* Must check second char since first char alone higher prededence 
03254        * than ||
03255        */
03256       else if ((ch == '|') && (ch2 != '|') && (current_precedence < 6))
03257         Perror (pptr, "'|' not supported in floating point expressions.");
03258       else
03259         {
03260           /* Go back to placemark position before returning */
03261           move_Pptr (pptr, placemark);
03262           break;
03263         }
03264     }
03265 
03266   /* Free placemark */
03267   free_Pptr (placemark);
03268   return (result);
03269 }
03270 
03271 double
03272 Pcalc_C_float_factor (Pptr * pptr)
03273 {
03274   double result = 0.0;
03275   int ch, sign_operator;
03276   Pptr *placemark;
03277   Mbuf *double_mbuf;
03278   int after_decimal_point, in_exponent;
03279   char *double_string, *end_ptr;
03280   Pskip_whitespace (pptr);
03281   ch = Ppeekc (pptr);
03282   /* Detect sign operators */
03283   if ((ch == '-') || (ch == '+'))
03284     {
03285       /* Get sign operator and skip whitespace until next character */
03286       sign_operator = ch;
03287       Pgetc (pptr);
03288       Pskip_whitespace (pptr);
03289       ch = Ppeekc (pptr);
03290     }
03291   else
03292     sign_operator = 0;
03293   /* Handle numbers */
03294   if (isdigit (ch) || (ch == '.'))
03295     {
03296       /* Initialize state to allow only one decimal point or
03297        * exponent.
03298        */
03299       after_decimal_point = 0;
03300       in_exponent = 0;
03301       /* Create a mbuf to hold number being built */
03302       double_mbuf = create_Mbuf ();
03303       /* Add the first character to the mbuf */
03304       ch = Pgetc (pptr);
03305       addc_to_Mbuf (double_mbuf, ch);
03306       /* If decimal point, require the next character to be
03307        * a digit.
03308        */
03309       if (ch == '.')
03310         {
03311           ch = Ppeekc (pptr);
03312           if (!isdigit (ch))
03313             {
03314               Perror (pptr,
03315                       "Digit required after '.' in floating-point expression.");
03316             }
03317 
03318           /* Flag that have seen the only decimal point allowed */
03319           after_decimal_point = 1;
03320         }
03321 
03322       /* Allocate placemark, since can be recursively called 
03323        * inside loop.
03324        */
03325       placemark = copy_Pptr (pptr);
03326       /* Get remaining digits */
03327       while (1)
03328         {
03329           /* Get placemark so can restore if not a character */
03330           move_Pptr (placemark, pptr);
03331           /* Get and process character */
03332           ch = Ppeekc (pptr);
03333           /* If digit, just place in string */
03334           if (isdigit (ch))
03335             {
03336               ch = Pgetc (pptr);
03337               addc_to_Mbuf (double_mbuf, ch);
03338             }
03339 
03340           /* If decimal point, make sure in valid spot */
03341           else if (ch == '.')
03342             {
03343               /* Cannot have two decimal points */
03344               if (after_decimal_point)
03345                 {
03346                   Perror (pptr,
03347                           "Unexpected second decimal point in floating-point "
03348                           "number.");
03349                 }
03350 
03351               /* Cannot have decimal point in exponent */
03352               if (in_exponent)
03353                 {
03354                   Perror (pptr, "Unexpected decimal point in exponent.");
03355                 }
03356 
03357               /* Add decimal point to string */
03358               ch = Pgetc (pptr);
03359               addc_to_Mbuf (double_mbuf, ch);
03360               /* Flag that after decimal point */
03361               after_decimal_point = 1;
03362             }
03363 
03364           /* Handle exponent specifier */
03365           else if ((ch == 'e') || (ch == 'E'))
03366             {
03367               /* Make don't already in exponent */
03368               if (in_exponent)
03369                 {
03370                   Perror (pptr, "Unexpected second exponent specified.");
03371                 }
03372 
03373               /* Flag that in exponent now */
03374               in_exponent = 1;
03375               /* Add exponent specifier to string */
03376               ch = Pgetc (pptr);
03377               addc_to_Mbuf (double_mbuf, ch);
03378               /* Get optional + or - */
03379               ch = Ppeekc (pptr);
03380               if ((ch == '+') || (ch == '-'))
03381                 {
03382                   ch = Pgetc (pptr);
03383                   addc_to_Mbuf (double_mbuf, ch);
03384                 }
03385 
03386               /* Make sure followed by a digit (with or without sign) */
03387               ch = Ppeekc (pptr);
03388               if (!isdigit (ch))
03389                 {
03390                   Perror (pptr, "Exponent expected not '%c'.", ch);
03391                 }
03392             }
03393           else
03394             {
03395               /* Restore to right after number */
03396               move_Pptr (pptr, placemark);
03397               break;
03398             }
03399         }
03400 
03401       /* Convert double string to double */
03402       double_string = get_Mbuf_buf (double_mbuf);
03403       result = strtod (double_string, &end_ptr);
03404       /* Make sure have legal double */
03405       if (*end_ptr != 0)
03406         {
03407           Perror (pptr, "Invalid float number '%s' in expression.",
03408                   double_string);}
03409 
03410       /* Free mbuf (this also frees double_string!) */
03411       free_Mbuf (double_mbuf);
03412       free_Pptr (placemark);
03413     }
03414 
03415   /* Handle parenthesis */
03416   else if (ch == '(')
03417     {
03418       /* Get '(', get internal expression value, and ending ')' */
03419       Pgetc (pptr);
03420       result = Pcalc_C_float_expr (pptr, 0);
03421       Pskip_whitespace (pptr);
03422       if ((ch = Ppeekc (pptr)) == ')')
03423         Pgetc (pptr);
03424       else
03425         {
03426           Perror (pptr, "Floating-point expression error: ')' expected.");
03427         }
03428     }
03429 
03430   else
03431     {
03432       if (sign_operator != 0)
03433         {
03434           Perror (pptr,
03435                   "Floating-point expression error: integer, '.', or '(' "
03436                   "expected.");
03437         }
03438       else
03439         {
03440           Perror (pptr,
03441                   "Floating-point expression error: integer , '(', '.', or "
03442                   "sign (-, +) expected.");
03443         }
03444 
03445     }
03446 
03447   if (sign_operator != 0)
03448     {
03449       switch (sign_operator)
03450         {
03451         case '-':
03452           result = -result;
03453           break;
03454         case '+':
03455           break;
03456         default:
03457           Perror (pptr,
03458                   "Algorithm error: undefined sign operator '%c'.",
03459                   sign_operator);}
03460     }
03461 
03462 
03463   return (result);
03464 }
03465 
03466 
03467 
03468 /* Create Pdef structure */
03469 Pdef *
03470 create_Pdef (char *name, char *val, int allow_implicit_replacement, int level)
03471 {
03472   Pdef *def;
03473   def = (Pdef *) L_alloc (Pdef_pool);
03474   def->name = strdup (name);
03475   def->val = strdup (val);
03476   def->allow_implicit_replacement = allow_implicit_replacement;
03477   def->level = level;
03478   return (def);
03479 }
03480 
03481 void
03482 free_Pdef (void *def_v)
03483 {
03484   Pdef *def;
03485   def = (Pdef *) def_v;
03486   free (def->name);
03487   free (def->val);
03488   L_free (Pdef_pool, def);
03489 }
03490 
03491 void
03492 add_Pdef (char *name, char *val, int allow_implicit_replacement, int level)
03493 {
03494   Psymbol *psymbol;
03495   Pdef *pdef;
03496   /* If symbol already in table, replace val, otherwise make new
03497    * entry.
03498    */
03499   psymbol = find_Psymbol (Pdef_table, name);
03500   if (psymbol == NULL)
03501     {
03502       pdef = create_Pdef (name, val, allow_implicit_replacement, level);
03503       add_Psymbol (Pdef_table, name, (void *) pdef);
03504     }
03505   else
03506     {
03507       pdef = (Pdef *) psymbol->data;
03508       /* Ignore new definition if existing defintion is at a 
03509        * higher level.
03510        */
03511       if (pdef->level > level)
03512         return;
03513       free (pdef->val);
03514       pdef->val = strdup (val);
03515       pdef->allow_implicit_replacement = allow_implicit_replacement;
03516       pdef->level = level;
03517     }
03518 }
03519 
03520 void
03521 delete_Pdef (char *name)
03522 {
03523   Psymbol *psymbol;
03524   /* Delete only if in symbol table */
03525   psymbol = find_Psymbol (Pdef_table, name);
03526   if (psymbol != NULL)
03527     delete_Psymbol (psymbol, free_Pdef);
03528 }
03529 
03530 /* Looks up name in Pdef_table and returns value if found, NULL otherwise 
03531  * If implicit replacement is set to 1, allow only definitions with
03532  * allow_implicit_replacement set to be found.
03533  */
03534 char *
03535 Plookup (char *name, int implicit_replacement)
03536 {
03537   Psymbol *symbol;
03538   Pdef *def;
03539   if ((symbol = find_Psymbol (Pdef_table, name)) != NULL)
03540     {
03541       def = (Pdef *) symbol->data;
03542       /* If an implicit replacement, allow only defs with 
03543        * allow_implicit_replacement set to be found.
03544        */
03545       if (implicit_replacement && !def->allow_implicit_replacement)
03546         return (NULL);
03547       return (def->val);
03548     }
03549 
03550   return (NULL);
03551 }
